concept.title: Introduction

conbody.p: Dear customer, thank you for choosing a KESLA product. We wish you success in your work. Read this manual carefully before you operate the product or do maintenance on it. A good knowledge of operation and careful maintenance are very important for occupational safety. In addition, they help you get the best performance from your KESLA product.

Before you operate the product, make sure that you understand every section of this manual. When you operate the product, obey all instructions given in this manual. If you are not sure what the instructions mean, contact your dealer.
If you have feedback to Kesla, use the feedback form at the end of this manual or give your feedback online at www.kesla.com.

ol.li: Read this manual first. Make sure that you understand the safety instructions and the operation instructions fully before you operate the product.
Make sure that compatible with the product.
Make sure that the necessary inspections are done as required by law.
Always operate your KESLA product carefully.
The more you use the product, the easier it will be to operate it.
Slowly operate all the cylinders fully in and out to make the seals more flexible.
Lubricate your KESLA product often. Apply a small quantity of grease each time. A large quantity of grease at irregular intervals can decrease the performance.
It is very important to keep the hydraulic system clean.
The trailer is filled at the factory with and loader with hydraulic oil.
Repair all defective parts immediately to prevent damage.
Obey all local rules and regulations.

concept.title: About this manual

conbody.p: This is a machine-specific instruction manual for the KESLA trailer. This manual is supplied with the trailer.
This manual is intended for persons who have previous experience with the operation of tractor-operated agricultural and forestry machines.
To operate KESLA trailers in a forest, you must have general knowledge and experience about forestry.

note.p: It is very important that you read and understand the operation, maintenance and safety instructions before you operate the trailer or do maintenance on it. If you do not have sufficient information on the operation and properties of the trailer, there is a risk of injury or death. Only approved persons are permitted to operate the trailer, do maintenance on the trailer or make adjustments to it.

concept.title: Lagring av veiledningen

conbody.p: Denne veiledningen er en viktig del av produktet. Sørg for at den oppbevares på et trygt sted under hele produktets brukstid. Hold veiledningen ren og lett tilgjengelig. Hvis endringer gjøres på KESLA-produktet, sørg for at all informasjon om disse legges til denne veiledningen. Hvis du selger KESLA-produktet, gi denne veiledningen videre til den nye eieren.

concept.title: Innhold i håndboken

conbody.p: Denne håndboken inkluderer følgende informasjon:

ul.li: Generell informasjon om formålet med og innholdet i håndboken, instruksjoner om hvordan håndboken skal leses, og en anmodning om å gi tilbakemelding og rapportere om mulige feil.
Sikkerhetsinstruksjoner
Generell informasjon om produktet, inkludert produktets tilsiktede bruk
Modellspesifikasjoner
Informasjon om inspeksjoner
Driftsinstruksjoner
Vedlikeholdsinstruksjoner
Instruksjoner om lagring og oppbevaring
Feilsøking

conbody.p: Det primære målesystemet i dette dokumentet er metrisk (SI). Den primære temperaturenheten er celsius (°C). Hvis andre, ikke-metriske måleenheter brukes, er de avrundet til nærmeste heltall.

Illustrasjonene i dette dokumentet er bare til orientering. De viser typiske situasjoner og driftsoperasjoner for produktet. KESLA-produktet du bruker, kan avvike litt fra illustrasjonene. Enkelte komponenter er fjernet fra illustrasjonene for å hjelpe deg med å se de nødvendige delene.

Advarslene i dette dokumentet omfatter ikke alle mulige situasjoner og omstendigheter. Hvis du har spørsmål om installasjon, drift, vedlikehold eller generell sikkerhet i forbindelse med KESLA-produktet, kan du kontakte arbeidslederen og/eller forhandleren.

Alle opplysninger, spesifikasjoner og illustrasjoner er basert på informasjonen som var tilgjengelig på tidspunktet for utarbeidelse av dette dokumentet. Kesla Oyj utvikler kontinuerlig sine produkter. Kesla forbeholder seg retten til å endre innholdet i dette dokumentet uten ytterligere varsel.

note.p: De opprinnelige instruksjonene er på engelsk og finsk. Instruksjoner som publiseres på andre språk, er oversettelser av de opprinnelige instruksjonene på engelsk. De opprinnelige instruksjonene er skrevet på forenklet teknisk engelsk (ASD-STE100).
Hvis det er avvik mellom den engelske teksten og oversettelsen, er det alltid den engelske teksten som er mest nøyaktig.

concept.title: Sikkerhetsinstruksjoner

conbody.p: Disse sikkerhetsinstruksjonene angir de nødvendige sikkerhetsprosedyrer som alt personale må overholde under bruken av maskineriet.
Feil bruk av maskineriet kan føre til personskade eller dødsfall. Derfor tillates bare autoriserte personer å bruke maskineriet, utføre vedlikehold på maskineriet eller foreta justeringer på det.

Overhold alltid gjeldende sikkerhetsinstrukser og andre bestemmelser. Hvis du ikke overholder sikkerhetsinstruksene, er det fare for skade eller død. Det finnes også fare for skade på maskineriet, kjøretøyet eller gjenstander i nærheten av maskineriet.
Overhold alltid gjeldende lover, bestemmelser, lokale forskrifter og regler når du bruker maskineriet eller utfører vedlikehold på det.
Før du bruker maskineriet, eller utfører vedlikehold på det:

ul.li: Les bruks-, vedlikeholds- og sikkerhetsinstruksene i veiledningen.

Kontroller at du forstår bruks-, vedlikeholds- og sikkerhetsinstruksene i denne veiledningen i sin helhet. Hvis du ikke har nok informasjon om bruken og egenskapene til maskineriet, er det fare for personskade eller dødsfall.

conbody.p: Det er ikke mulig å lage en liste over alle farer som kan oppstå under alle forhold. Hvis du har spørsmål om bruk, vedlikehold eller generell sikkerhet, kontakt din lokale forhandler før du bruker maskineriet eller utfører vedlikehold på det.

concept.title: Sikkerhetsmeldinger

conbody.p: Sikkerhetsmeldingene som brukes i denne veiledningen, har et sikkerhetssymbol og en skriftlig advarsel. Sikkerhetsmeldingene har tre kategorier iht. farens grad.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: FARE forteller deg at situasjonen vil forårsake alvorlige personskader eller dødsfall hvis du ikke unngår den.
ADVARSEL forteller deg at situasjonen kan forårsake alvorlige personskader eller dødsfall hvis du ikke unngår den.
FORSIKTIG forteller deg at det er fare for skader på maskineriet, kjøretøyet eller gjenstander.

note.p: MERK gir informasjon som hjelper deg under en prosedyre.

concept.title: Advarselssymboler

conbody.p: Advarselssymboler i denne veiledningen gir informasjon om farer, forbudte handlinger og obligatoriske handlinger.

entry.p: Et svart symbol inne i en gul trekant identifiserer en fare.
Et svart symbol i en rød sirkel identifiserer en handling som ikke er tillatt.
Et hvitt symbol på blå bakgrunn identifiserer en handling som du må foreta for å unngå en fare.

concept.title: Safety and instruction labels

conbody.p: The trailer and loader have safety and instruction labels that give instructions to the operator. Obey the instruction labels to prevent accidents and damage to the trailer and loader.

note.p: If an instruction label is damaged or missing, it must be replaced immediately. You can get new labels from your local dealer or the manufacturer.

section.title: Product label
section.p: The product label shows the make of the trailer and the loader.

section.title: Model label
section.p: The model label shows the model of the loader.

section.title: Lubrication label
section.p: The lubrication label on the trailer gives the operator instructions about the daily lubrication of the articulated drawbar.

section.title: Operation manual label
section.p: This label tells the operator to read the Operation manual before the operation, installation, maintenance or repair of the trailer.

The owner or person who is responsible for the trailer must:
Give instructions to all operators of the trailer for operation, installation, maintenance and repair
Make sure that the operator reads the Operation manual.

The owner or person who is responsible for the trailer must, within 14 days of the delivery, return to the manufacturer the documents that follow:
The bill of delivery
The assurance that the owner and/or the operator has read the Operation manual and knows how to use the trailer.
Read the .
The return address for the documents is:
Kesla Oyj, Metsolantie 2, 59800 Kesälahti, Finland.
after.sales@kesla.com

section.title: Warning label
section.p:
This label has three messages:
Read the Operation manual before operation, installation, maintenance or repair of the trailer.
Do not go near high-voltage power lines.
Do not go below an unsupported tipping platform. Always use the maintenance support when you do work below the platform.

section.title: Safety distance from power lines label

ul.li: This warning label gives the operator information about the safety distance from power lines.
This label also tells that other persons must be outside the minimum safety distance from the loader when it is in operation.
Make sure that this label is easy to see and read during the operation of the loader.
This label is supplied with the operation manual.

fig.title: Safety distance from power lines label

section.title: Pinch hazard label
section.p: This label tells the operator to be very careful near the trailer, because there is a pinch hazard.

section.title: Maximum RPM and oil information label
section.p: This label tells the operator the maximum RPM, oil type and oil quantity.

section.title: Maintenance position label
section.p: This label is attached to the trailer frame below the maintenance support. It reminds the operator to use the maintenance support.

ul.li: This label is large. It tells the minimum safety distance during operation.
This label is attached to the left and right side of the outer boom.
The minimum safety distance during operation is 25 m (82 ft).
Before you start to operate the loader, make sure that all persons are outside the minimum safety distance from the loader.
The minimum safety distance can be different because of local laws and on-site regulations.
Obey the local laws and regulations for longer safety distances.
The minimum safety distance is always 25 m (82 ft).
The load plate on the loader gives the operator information about the permitted maximum loads at different outreach levels.

section.title: Hooks not permitted label
section.p: The hook label on the loader tells the operator that hooks are not permitted.

section.title: Lifting point label
section.p: The lifting point labels show the lifting points on the trailer and the loader.

concept.title: Generell sikkerhet

ul.li: Sørg for at du leser og forstår bruks-, vedlikeholds- og sikkerhetsinstruksene før du bruker maskineriet eller utfører vedlikehold på det. Hvis du ikke har tilstrekkelig informasjon om bruken og egenskapene til maskineriet, er det fare for personskade eller dødsfall. Bare autoriserte personer tillattes å bruke maskineriet , utføre vedlikehold på maskineriet eller foreta justeringer på det.

Bruk alltid aktuelt personlig verneutstyr før maskineriet tas i bruk. Dette utstyret kan inkludere vernehjelm, vernedrakt, vernesko, hørselsvern, vernebriller og annet verneutstyr som gjelder for oppgaven din.
Hvis kjøretøyet har en hovedstrømbryter, slå den AV før du forlater kjøretøyet.
Overhold sikkerhets- og instruksetikettene på maskineriet for å forebygge ulykker når du bruker det.
Bruk ikke maskineriet hvis det er skadet eller defekt.
Lær å bruke maskineriet før du begynner arbeidet.
Start ikke en oppgave som du ikke er opplært eller autorisert til å gjøre.
Planlegg arbeidet nøye på forhånd for hindre skader og ulykker.
Foreta nødvendige vedlikeholds- eller reparasjons- arbeider før du bruker maskineriet.
Rengjør maskineriet regelmessig.
La ikke andre personer bruke maskineriet før du forsikrer deg om at de har lest og forstått sikkerhets- og bruksinstruksene i sin helhet.

concept.title: Lifting safety

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Be careful when you lift and move the trailer. The trailer can fall and cause serious injury or death.
Use applicable lifting equipment. Obey the instructions of the lifting equipment manufacturer.
Use applicable personal protective equipment.
Be careful when you lift and move the trailer. Because of its weight, the trailer can crush a person if it falls or moves suddenly. This will cause serious injury or death.
Use applicable personal protective equipment.
Be careful when you lift and move the trailer or do maintenance on it. The trailer or a component can fall and cause serious injury or death.
Use applicable personal protective equipment.
Be careful when you lift metal bridge parts. They can move in the grapple while you lift them and fall. It will cause serious injury, death or material damage.

note.p: Always obey all applicable local laws and regulations, safety procedures and precautions for lifting.
Make sure that the lifting equipment is applicable for the task.
Make sure that the lifting equipment is in good condition.

concept.title: Safety devices

conbody.p:
The function of the protective plate on the directional valve of the loader is to catch oil spray. Make sure that the protective plate is serviceable and in correct position.
1Protective plate

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Emergency stop switches

conbody.p: The tractor must have an emergency stop switch (standard EN12999) in the cabin. The emergency stop switch stops the oil supply to the loader. If the engine stop switch of the tractor is clearly marked and easy to access, it is also an applicable emergency stop switch.
The stop button on the control panel of the loader is not an emergency stop.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Safety on the road

ul.li: Make sure that you read and understand the road safety instructions before you drive the vehicle.
If the driver does not obey the road safety instructions in this manual, the manufacturer or the dealer is not liable for the damage the vehicle causes.
Before you drive on the road, put the loader in the transport position. Refer to for instructions.
Make sure that all accessories are in the correct transport position.
Obey all road traffic rules and regulations when you drive on public roads.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Transport position

ul.li: Before you drive on the road, put the boom of the loader in the transport position. Refer to .
Before you drive, make sure that all the trailer parts are in correct position.
Make sure that the accessories and the load are carefully attached to the trailer to prevent accidents.
Before you drive on the road, make sure that you lock the articulated drawbar.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Driving safety

ul.li: When you drive the vehicle, make sure that you can control it in all situations. Keep in mind that the vehicle stopping distance is longer with the trailer and the load.
Make sure that the load is carefully attached to the trailer with load straps.

conbody.p:
Before you drive the vehicle, do the steps that follow:
Make sure that all the necessary equipment, for example, lights, reflectors and warning devices are serviceable and in the correct position.
Examine the tire pressure.
Make sure that the load does not come out of the sides of the trailer.
Make sure that the load stays in place during transport.
Make sure that all persons are outside the minimum safety distance from the trailer.
Make sure that you can see well around the vehicle.
Examine the brakes.

ul.li: Make sure that the axle weights, the gross weight of the vehicle and the transport dimensions are not more than permitted.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Driving and driving speed

ul.li: Obey all road traffic rules and regulations when you drive on public roads.
Adapt the driving speed to the situation to make sure that you can always control the vehicle.
Be very careful when you drive on slopes and hills. Do not turn the vehicle suddenly.
The maximum permitted driving speed is 40 km/h.
Keep in mind that the vehicle stopping distance is longer with the trailer and the load.
Keep in mind that the height of the load can have an effect on how easy the vehicle is to control.
Be very careful on slippery and rough surfaces.
Obey the safety distances from power lines when the vehicle is near power or telephone lines.
Before you drive under an overpass, make sure that the overpass is not too low.
Before you drive the vehicle, always plan the route to prevent risks on public roads.
Do not drink alcohol or use intoxicating substances when you drive.
Do not use the rear traction when you drive on the road.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Loading, drawbar weights and drawbar eye

ul.li: Make sure that you know how much weight is on the trailer's drawbar and the drawbar eye. The weight can change with the load.
There is a risk of accident, if you put too much weight on the drawbar.

conbody.p:
The weight on the drawbar is at its heaviest when:
The trailer is full
The load is in front of the bogie-axle.
The weight on the drawbar is at its lightest when part of the load is behind the bogie-axle.

The maximum drawbar weights for trailers are:
2500 kg / (≤40 km/h)
You must also know the maximum load of the tractor tow hook.
Examine the drawbar eye regularly. Replace worn or damaged eye with a new original spare part. If the material thickness of the eye has decreased by 30% in one direction, it must be replaced.
Obey all local road traffic rules and regulations on permitted load lengths.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Operation safety

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Be careful around the trailer. If the trailer is parked on a slope, it can move and crush a person. It will cause serious injury or death.
Engage the parking brake.
Be very careful when you do work near the turning trailer parts. Loose clothes, tools or long hair can wind around them. It will cause serious injury or death.
Make sure that the covers on the cardan shaft are not damaged. Attach the locking chains carefully.
Do not go in the danger area near the articulated drawbar.

Do not park the trailer or operate it on a slope if its angle is more than the maximum permitted angle. The maximum permitted angle is 18 degrees. If the angle of the slope is more than the maximum permitted angle, the trailer is not stable and can tilt suddenly. It will cause serious injury or death.
Be very careful when you operate the trailer on slippery surfaces. Do not put too much load on the trailer or drive too fast.
Do not tilt the tipping platform up near overhead power lines. Electric shock will cause serious injury or death.
Obey the safety distance to the power lines.

Be very careful when you move the platform or the loader after commissioning, maintenance, repairs and equivalent. There can be air in the hydraulic system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements. These movements will cause serious injury or death.
Do not lift a load above persons with the loader. The load can fall and cause serious injury or death.
Before you lift a load, make sure that there are no persons in the danger area.
The minimum safety distance during operation is 25 m (82 ft) when you use the loader.
Do not put too much weight on the trailer. The load can fall and cause serious injury or death.
Make sure that you attach the load to the trailer with load straps.
Do not touch high-voltage wires with the loader. It will cause serious injury or death.
When you operate the loader near power lines, obey the safety distances.
If the voltage of the power line is 110 kV or more, the minimum safety distance is 5 m.
If the fixing screws of the loader or the slewing mechanism break, it will cause serious injury or death.
Always use fixing screws and other fastening supplies recommended in the manual.
Examine the tightness of the fixing screws regularly.
Before you start to operate the trailer, make sure that all persons are outside the minimum safety distance from the trailer.
The safety distance during operation is 25 m (82 ft).
Do not put your hands or other parts of the body below the load. It can cause serious injury or death.
Do not put your fingers or hands between the tailgate and the platform. It can cause serious injury.
Be very careful when you do work near the platform.
Stop the engine before you do work in the danger area of the platform. Make sure that there are no other persons in the danger area.
Be very careful when you drive on public roads. The trailer can get caught and stop on soft roads.
Be very careful when you drive on public roads. A slow-moving vehicle can cause danger on the roads.
Make sure that all the necessary equipment, for example lights and reflectors, are serviceable.
Do not lift persons with the loader. It can cause serious injury or death.
Be very careful when you do work on the platform. You can fall to the ground. It can cause injury or death.
If you see a leak in a hydraulic hose, do not go near it. Defective hydraulic hoses can spray oil with high pressure. Oil spray is dangerous to the skin and eyes.
If an accident occurs, get medical aid immediately.

Examine the condition of hydraulic hoses regularly. Move, for example, a piece of cardboard along the hoses to find possible small leaks. Replace worn or damaged hydraulic hoses before you use the trailer.

ul.li: Be very careful when you attach the trailer to the tractor.
You can become pinched between the tractor and the trailer structures. It can cause serious injury or material damage.
If it is not necessary, do not go between the tractor and the trailer.
Be very careful when you operate the hydraulic articulated drawbar.
The trailer stability decreases on a slope. If you turn the drawbar downhill and park the trailer on a slope, the trailer can tilt. It can cause serious injury or material damage.
Do not use the hydraulic drawbar control if other persons are near the trailer.
Do not operate the trailer before you read the operation and safety instructions.
Do not put too much load on the trailer.
Do not transport persons on the trailer.
Do not compress the load with the loader.
Do not operate the loader if it is damaged or defective.
Do not operate the loader if you are under 18 years old.
Do not operate the loader if your hearing or eyesight is poor.

Make sure that you read and understand the operation, maintenance and safety instructions before you operate the machinery or do maintenance on it. If you do not have sufficient information on the operation and properties of the machinery, there is a risk of injury or death. Only approved persons are permitted to operate the machinery, do maintenance on the machinery or make adjustments to it.
KESLA multipurpose trailer is made for transportation of sand, gravel and other loose material, timber transportation from the forest and general cargo transportation.
Only approved persons are permitted to operate the trailer.
Make sure that the load on the trailer is not more than the maximum permitted load of the tractor tow hook.
Make sure that the trailer's drawbar eye is locked to the tractor's tow hook.
Make sure that the articulated drawbar is serviceable.
Obey the maintenance instructions.
Vehicle noise can damage your hearing and cause deafness.
Use applicable personal hearing protection when necessary.
The noise level at the work site is different if the sound proofing of the tractor you use with the trailer is different.

Always put on applicable personal protective equipment before you operate the machinery. These can include a safety helmet, protective clothing, safety footwear, hearing protection, safety glasses and other protective equipment applicable to your task.

section.title: Attach the trailer safely to a tractor

ul.li: Do the daily inspection procedure for the loader. Refer to .
Do the necessary maintenance or repair operations.
Be very careful when you attach the trailer to the power take-off of the tractor.
Make sure that the hydraulic pressure is disconnected from the trailer and the loader when you start the engine.
Put the loader in the transport position. Refer to for instructions.
Plan your work carefully beforehand to prevent damage and accidents.
If necessary, put warning signs around your work area.
Make sure that the ground below the vehicle can hold the weight of the trailer and that it cannot tilt.
Engage the parking brakes before you start to operate the loader. Keep the parking brakes engaged during loading. If necessary, put wheel chocks in front of the wheels.
Adjust the loader in the upright position with the stabilizers.
When you operate the vehicle, make sure that no persons are in the danger area.
Make sure that you can always see the load and the end of the boom when you lift a load with the loader.
Do not operate the loader in a slope if you can do it on a level surface. If you must operate the loader in a slope, be very careful and lift small loads.
If you go away from the vehicle, always stop the engine.
Do not stand below the boom of the loader.
Do not tow anything with the loader.
Do not drink alcohol or use intoxicating substances when you operate the vehicle.
Put the loader in the transport position. Refer to for instructions.
Be very careful when you disconnect the trailer from the power take-off of the tractor.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Maintenance safety

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Do not do work below the tipping platform without the maintenance support. The tipping platform can come down and cause serious injury or death.
Always lift the maintenance support before you do work below the tipping platform while the tipping mechanism holds it up.
Put applicable supports below or around the loader components before you do maintenance or repairs.
A component in the hydraulic system can fall during maintenance or repairs. It will cause serious injury or death.

Be very careful when you move the platform or the loader after commissioning, maintenance, repairs and equivalent. There can be air in the hydraulic system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements. These movements will cause serious injury or death.
If you see a leak in a hydraulic hose, do not go near it. Defective hydraulic hoses can spray oil with high pressure. Oil spray is dangerous to the skin and eyes.
If an accident occurs, get medical aid immediately.

Examine the condition of hydraulic hoses regularly. Move, for example, a piece of cardboard along the hoses to find possible small leaks. Replace worn or damaged hydraulic hoses before you use the trailer.
Ved bruk av olje og smørefett må du overholde de lokale forskriftene og instruksjonene fra olje- og fettprodusentene.
Send inn avfallsolje til passende behandling i henhold til lokale lover og forskrifter.
Olje og fett kan inneholde tilsetningsstoffer som kan være farlige for huden og miljøet.

Be careful not to get oil or grease on your skin. They contain solvents and additives that can be dangerous for your skin (the skin dries and cracks). Used, dirty oil or grease is more dangerous than new.
When you use oil and grease, obey the local regulations and the instructions of oil and grease manufacturers.
If oil or grease causes you dermatitis, inflammation or other skin reaction, get medical aid immediately.
Hvis du søler olje, må du umiddelbart fjerne den.
Send inn avfallsolje til passende behandling i henhold til lokale lover og forskrifter.
Olje og fett er farlig for miljøet.
Be very careful when you increase the tire pressure of old tires. Examine the tires before you increase the pressure.
Worn or old trailer tires can explode when the pressure increases. The explosion can cause serious injury or death.
Ikke endre trykkverdiene for ventilene i hydraulikksystemet.
Hold trykket i hydraulikksystemet under de tillatte verdiene. Hvis trykket er høyere enn de tillatte verdiene, kan det forårsake alvorlige personskader og alvorlige skader.

ul.li: Make sure that you read and understand the operation, maintenance and safety instructions before you operate the machinery or do maintenance on it. If you do not have sufficient information on the operation and properties of the machinery, there is a risk injury or death. Only approved persons are permitted to operate the machinery, do maintenance on the machinery or make adjustments to it.
Use applicable protective clothing, protective skin creams or applicable gloves when you use oil or grease. Be careful not to get oil or grease on your skin.
If oil or grease damages your skin, get medical aid immediately.
Stop the engine and take the ignition key with you before you do adjustments or maintenance to the trailer or loader, clean the trailer, or go away from it.
Only use original parts to repair or to do maintenance on the mechanical transmission or hydraulics.
Only persons trained on hydraulic systems are permitted to measure the pressure in the hydraulic system and adjust it.

Be very careful when you measure the pressure in the hydraulic system and adjust it. Make sure that the hose on the pressure gauge is sufficiently long to get from the test point to the operation valve.

concept.title: Hydraulic system safety

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Be very careful when you move the platform or the loader after commissioning, maintenance, repairs and equivalent. There can be air in the hydraulic system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements. These movements will cause serious injury or death.
If you see a leak in a hydraulic hose, do not go near it. Defective hydraulic hoses can spray oil with high pressure. Oil spray is dangerous to the skin and eyes.
If an accident occurs, get medical aid immediately.

Examine the condition of hydraulic hoses regularly. Move, for example, a piece of cardboard along the hoses to find possible small leaks. Replace worn or damaged hydraulic hoses before you use the trailer.
Ikke endre trykkverdiene for ventilene i hydraulikksystemet.
Hold trykket i hydraulikksystemet under de tillatte verdiene. Hvis trykket er høyere enn de tillatte verdiene, kan det forårsake alvorlige personskader og alvorlige skader.

ul.li: Obey the safety instructions of the hydraulic system when you connect the hydraulics to the trailer and operate the hydraulics.
Only persons trained on the maintenance and repairs of the hydraulic system are permitted to install components to the system and to do maintenance and repairs to the system.
Do not start a task if you are not sure that you can do it.
Only use original spare parts for maintenance and repairs of the hydraulic system.
Only use parts with sufficient pressure resistance.
Make sure that the hydraulic hoses are serviceable. Replace damaged hydraulic hoses before you use the trailer.

concept.title: Sikkerhetsinstrukser for sveising

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Sveis ikke maskineriet hvis du ikke har yrkesopplæring i dette.
Feil reparasjon av struktur kan føre til plutselig brudd. Dette kan forårsake alvorlig personskade eller materielle skader.

ul.li: Undersøk materialet som skal sveises. Velg egnet sveisemetode og sveisematerialer før sveising. Skriv, om nødvendig, til Kesla for mer informasjon.
Overhold sveiseinstruksene, og bruk egnede sveisemetoder.
Bruk alltid aktuelt personlig verneutstyr.
Hvis reparasjonssveising av strukturen er nødvendig, skriv til produsenten for å få sveise- og reparasjonsinstrukser først.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Installasjon av tilbehør og modifisering av strukturen

ul.li: Ikke utfør endringer på hengeren eller lasteren uten Keslas godkjenning. Ikke-godkjente endringer på hengeren, lasteren eller strukturen kan forårsake dødsfall, alvorlige personskader eller materielle skader. Foreta et anslag av risikoene igjen, og få Keslas godkjenning før du utfører endringene.
Kontakt produsenten før du installerer et tilbehør som ikke er et Kesla Oyj-produkt.
Kontakt produsenten før du utfører endringer på strukturen på tilhengeren eller lasteren.
Ikke gjør endringer eller reparasjonsarbeid som ikke er inkludert i denne håndboken, uten Keslas godkjenning. Få Keslas godkjenning før du utfører slike endringer eller reparasjoner.
Endringer og reparasjoner som ikke er inkludert i denne håndboken, kan påvirke driften, sikkerheten og anvendbarheten.

For å få Keslas godkjenning må du utføre en grundig risikoanalyse når du utarbeider endringene eller reparasjonene. Risikoanalysen må inkludere gjenværende risikoer og de nye risikoene som endringene eller reparasjonene kan forårsake.

conbody.p: Hvis endringer eller reparasjoner gjøres på hengeren eller lasteren uten Keslas godkjenning, og disse endringene eller reparasjonene forhindrer korrekt bruk av maskineriet eller virker inn på sikkerheten eller anvendbarheten, er ikke produsenten ansvarlig for hendelser som forårsaker dødsfall, personskader eller materielle skader.
Endringer som gjøres på lasterens struktur, kan forårsake overbelastningssituasjoner og en økt risiko for ulykker.
Endringer som gjøres på hengeren eller lasteren uten Keslas godkjenning, kan ugyldiggjøre garantien.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Intended use of the product

conbody.p: KESLA multipurpose trailer is a trailer for agricultural tractors.
The tipping platform is installed to a high-performance timber trailer chassis that has a traction system and a hydraulic articulated drawbar. The loader is installed to the trailer frame.

The multipurpose trailer is made for transportation of sand, gravel and other loose material, timber transportation from the forest and general cargo transportation. It can also be used to transport and move parts for temporary bridges and beam bridges.

The loader is made for loading and unloading cut-to-length timber. If you have lifters (accessory), you can also lift pallets with the loader. When applicable grapples are installed, the loader can also be used to load sand, gravel and other loose materials. In military use, the loader can also be used in the installation of bridge parts.
Tools and accessories are stowed in the storage locations of the trailer. For example, the posts for timber transportation are stowed below the platform.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Prohibited uses

conbody.p: Do not use the loader or the trailer for these purposes:

ul.li: Do not install a hook to the loader on the trailer. Load pallets with the lifters or the front loader of the tractor. Load other general cargo and heavy items on the trailer platform with the front loader of the tractor or equivalent.
Do not lift persons with the loader.
Do not let persons climb onto the trailer while it moves.
Do not transport persons on the trailer drawbar or on the trailer.
Do not use the loader or the trailer if it is unserviceable or damaged.
Do not use the loader or the trailer near power lines or phone lines. Always obey the safety distance of 5 m.
Do not use the loader or the trailer near other persons. Always obey the safety distance of 25 m.
Do not use the loader or the trailer if you have not read the Operation manual.
Do not operate the loader when the tractor or the trailer moves.
Do not do work below the tipping platform without the maintenance support when the tipping platform is up.
Do not disconnect the trailer hydraulics from the tractor when the tipping platform is tilted.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Recommended operating conditions

conbody.p: The lowest recommended operating temperature is -25 °C. In lower temperatures, hydraulic gaskets wear quickly, the risk of brittle fracture in steel structures increases, and the hoses can become damaged.
If you operate the trailer and the loader in temperatures below -25 °C, lift and move smaller loads than usual to prevent damage.

If you operate the trailer and the loader at high temperatures, make sure that the hydraulic oil does not become too hot (more than 75 °C). Too high temperature decreases the life of the hydraulic oil and can cause damage to the gaskets.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Operating principle

conbody.p: The tractor driver uses the tractor movements to control the trailer movements.

The articulated drawbar movements are hydraulic. The tractor pressurizes the hydraulic system and the control valve operates the hydraulic cylinders. The hydraulic cylinders operate the articulated drawbar.

The tractor driver controls the movements of the loader with the control panel. The control panel operates the control valve. The loader does the specified function (e.g. turns the boom, lifts the boom, closes the grapple) when pressurized hydraulic oil flows from the control valve to the correct hydraulic cylinders.
The loader has pressure relief valves to prevent overloading of the machinery.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Trailer brakes

conbody.p: The trailer has disc brakes on all four wheels. The trailer brakes make the trailer safer to use. If you use them on the road, they help to keep the tractor brakes serviceable for a longer time.

There are two ways to use the trailer's hydraulic brakes:
Through the 1-way valve block
Directly with the tractor's brake valve.
If the tractor has a hydraulic brake valve or compressed air brakes, the trailer's brake connections are at the rear of the tractor. The brakes operate when you push the tractor's brake pedal.

concept.title: Lifting and towing instructions

ul.li: Always obey all applicable local laws and regulations, safety procedures and precautions for lifting. For more information about lifting safety, refer to .
Make sure that the lifting equipment is applicable for the task.
Make sure that the lifting equipment is in good condition.

conbody.p: Attach lifting slings to four lifting points on the trailer and two lifting points on the loader. Put blocks of wood between the trailer and the lifting sling to protect the lifting slings.
Make sure that the trailer stays horizontally level. Make sure that you lift the trailer from above its center of gravity.
Only use lifting points that are shown below.

The trailer has towing points below the platform at the rear of the trailer. If the soil is soft and you cannot pull the trailer forward with the tractor, you can pull it rearward from the towing points that are shown below.
Make sure that the equipment and the method that you use are applicable for towing.

More information about the accessories is available on our website www.kesla.com and from your local dealer.

Trailer accessories include:
Hydraulic tailgate

Loader accessories include:

concept.title: Generelle garantivilkår for Kesla-produktene.

p.b: Kesla Oyj tilbyr garantier for produktene de produserer i overensstemmelse med følgende vilkår:

ol.li: Garantien er bare gyldig for nye produkter som er solgt og produsert av Kesla. Garantien er bare gyldig for sluttkunden av det kjøpte produktet.

Kravene for garantien er:
at dokumentasjonen i henhold til kravene om installasjon og innkjøring er levert til Kesla innen en periode på 30 dager fra datoen da enheten ble levert til sluttkunden
at dokumentasjonen for eventuell ominstallasjon er levert innen en periode på 30 dager fra installasjonsdatoen
at Kesla er informert om eventuell endring av eierskap innen en periode på 30 dager
at vedlikehold er utført i henhold til vedlikeholdsplanen

Garantien starter fra den første dagen produktet settes i drift (senest datoen for levering til sluttkunden)
12 måneder eller 2000 arbeidstimer for bilkraner og industrikraner
24 måneder eller 4000 arbeidstimer for hovedkomponentene og rammestrukturene for bilkraner, bommer og svingeenheter
12 måneder eller 2000 arbeidstimer for lastere, hengere, skogsmaskinerikraner, hogstmaskiner og andre produktkombinasjoner og tilleggsutstyr som produseres av Kesla
12 måneder eller 1000 arbeidstimer for flishuggere
36 måneder for stålstrukturer på hengere, samt bommene på lastere som er installert på disse, så sant utstyret utgjør en del av en enhet som er spesifisert av Kesla
Garantiperioden for hver produktgruppe er halvparten av ovennevnte hvis maskineriet brukes av en utleiebedrift og/eller deles med andre eller brukes under forhold som fører til uvanlig overbelastning.
Garantien for reservedeler som selges av Kesla, er seks måneder fra leveringsdatoen.
Kesla garanterer ti års tilgjengelighet for delene de produserer etter at produksjonen av de aktuelle delene opphører.
Garantiperioden starter imidlertid alltid senest seks måneder etter datoen da produktet ble produsert.

Garantien opphører umiddelbart og fullstendig hvis:
produktet er reparert på feil måte
produktet er koblet til feil utstyr
ukjente og feilaktige deler eller utstyrsenheter er installert
de tillatte innstillingene for hydraulisk utstyr som er spesifisert av Kesla, er endret uten skriftlig samtykke fra Kesla

Garantien dekker ikke deler som slites under normal bruk (f.eks. filterelementer, oljer, slanger, pakninger, reimer, elektriske ledninger, glidelagre, glidedeler og andre lignende deler). Garantien dekker reservedeler og komponenter som er produsert av andre produsenter enn Kesla, bare hvis garantien som er utstedt av den aktuelle produsenten, dekker kostnadene som Kesla pådrar seg i forbindelse med utskiftning.

Garantien dekker ikke feil som skyldes
annen bruk enn den som er angitt i brukerhåndboken eller driftsinstruksjonene, vedlikeholds-, opplærings- eller sikkerhetsinstruksjonene, eller forsømmelse
feil eller utilstrekkelig installasjon eller vedlikehold
annen feilaktig eller forsømmelig bruk eller vedlikehold
normal slitasje eller forringelse
ulykker eller skader
overbelastning
urenheter i olje
andre årsaker som ikke er relatert til normal, tilsiktet bruk av produktet
eller andre årsaker som ikke er relatert til materielle defekter eller produksjonsfeil

Reparasjonsarbeid skal utelukkende utføres av Kesla eller Keslas autoriserte vedlikeholdsverksted. Reparasjonsarbeid skal utføres i vanlig arbeidstid og med normal kronologisk rekkefølge på oppgavene.
Den defekte maskindelen eller enheten kan repareres eller skiftes ut med en ny eller reparert del etter Keslas eget skjønn.
Kjøperen eller det autoriserte vedlikeholdsverkstedet må fylle ut Keslas garantikravskjema og levere det til Kesla innen 30 dager fra datoen da skaden oppstod.

Kesla utsteder en skriftlig garantiavgjørelse og sender et varsel om dette innen 30 (tretti) dager fra mottak av det utfylte garantikravet. Eventuell garantibehandlingstid i instansen som leverte en komponent til Kesla, kan forlenge tiden det tar å utstede beslutningen.

Keslas ettersalgsavdeling er ansvarlig for å ta avgjørelser som gjelder deler eller arbeid som faller innenfor garantiens omfang. Kesla har rett til å annullere en positiv garantiavgjørelse hvis det på et senere tidspunkt viser seg at feilen skyldtes én av årsakene som er angitt i klausul 6 i garantivilkårene.

De skadde delene skal oppbevares på korrekt måte i en periode på seks måneder. Om nødvendig skal de skadde delene leveres til Kesla før garantiavgjørelsen tas, inkludert kundens opplysninger og informasjon om maskinen. Kesla skal betale for fraktkostnadene, så sant dette er avtalt på forhånd med garantibehandleren. Kunden må ødelegge eventuelle skadde deler som forblir i vedkommendes besittelse på korrekt måte når dette stipuleres av Kesla, og senest ved utløpet av oppbevaringsperioden. Garantiperioden for nye deler som skiftes ut i garantiperioden utløper når den opprinnelige garantiperioden for selve produktet utløper. Alle deler som faller innenfor garantiens omfang, er Keslas eiendom.

Eventuelle kostnader som pådras ved oppfyllelse av garantiforpliktelsene, for eksempel reise- og overnattingskostnader for mekanikere, samt kostnader til transport av verktøy eller komponenter, overtidsbetaling og andre sammenlignbare ekstrakostnader, skal betales av sluttkunden.

Kesla er ikke ansvarlig for eventuelle direkte eller indirekte skader som skyldes det defekte produktet (f.eks. skader på annen eiendom, personskader, tap av inntekter, kundens reiseutgifter osv.), med mindre dette ansvaret er basert på lovgivningen.
Eventuelle produktspesifikke garantivilkår er å finne i driftsinstruksjonene for produktet.

concept.title: Registrering av produktet for garantiformål

conbody.p: For at garantien skal være gyldig må forhandleren registrere produktet i Keslas database.
Vi sender deg et registreringssammendrag på e-post etter at registreringen er fullført.

concept.title: Liability

conbody.p: If the operator does not obey the operation, maintenance and safety instructions in this manual, Kesla Oyj is not liable for the damage the trailer causes. Only persons who have fully read the instructions are permitted to use the trailer.
Only if you return the attached (of reading the instructions) in less than 14 days of the trailer delivery, Kesla Oyj is liable for the damage the trailer causes.

concept.title: Posts

conbody.p: The storage location for the posts is below the platform at the rear of the trailer. The posts are attached to the storage location with a chain.

The platform has holes for the posts on the left and right side of the platform for timber transportation purposes. You can also install posts to the holes in the center line of the platform to make partitions for timber. When the posts are not used, plugs are installed in the holes on the platform. Refer to for instructions.

conbody.p: Toolboxes are on the left and right side of the trailer below the front part of the tipping platform. The toolbox on the left in the figure above has shelves for load straps and a storage locker for a jack. The toolbox on the right does not have shelves. You can use it as a storage box for tarpaulins and other large items.

concept.title: Installation

ul.li: Make sure that you read and understand the operation, maintenance and safety instructions before you do the installation. If you do not have sufficient information on the operation and properties of the vehicle, there is a risk injury or death. Only approved persons are permitted to operate the vehicle, do maintenance on the vehicle or make adjustments to it.
Obey the safety instructions to prevent accidents. If the driver does not obey the safety instructions in this manual, the manufacturer or the dealer is not liable for the damage the vehicle causes.
Make sure that you know how to stop the tractor quickly to prevent, for example, the damage to the loader valve. Damage to the loader valve can cause oil to spill to the ground.
Make sure that the vehicle is always stable.

note.p: Before you connect the control system to the tractor, make sure that your tractor has a +12V (min. 25A) power outlet available for the control system. The 25A fuse is necessary for the correct operation of the system, especially if you connect the rear working light to the control system.

ul.li: Be very careful when you attach trailer to the tractor.
When you attach the trailer to the tractor or operate it, make sure that no persons are in the danger area.
You must know how to use the articulated drawbar before you start to operate the vehicle.

section.title: Do this before you operate the vehicle

ul.li: Write down the machine plate information for the trailer and the loader. Refer to .
Attach the trailer to the tractor. Refer to .
Install the electric cables and connect them. For instructions on how to connect the cables, refer to .
Make sure that the hydraulic hoses have protection.

TranslationLock.Head: Protection of hydraulic hoses and cylinders, submodules

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Protection of hydraulic hoses and cylinders

ul.li: If the hoses are installed inside the tractor, make sure that they have protection.
Protection of hoses can prevent injury. The hoses can break and spray oil.

conbody.p: Install the hoses carefully and put protection around them to make sure that they do not wear or twist. Make sure that the hoses are not caught when you operate the loader or other accessory equipment.
KESLA trailers have a special hose rack. The hydraulic hoses are installed through the rack.

KESLA trailers have a parking leg with quick couplings. When the trailer is not attached to the tractor, connect the hydraulic hoses to the quick couplings on the parking leg. This keeps the hoses clean during storage. Refer to .

note.p: Protective grease is applied to the cylinder piston rods of the loader at the factory. Before you use the loader, remove the grease. Thick grease and dirt attached to the grease can damage the piston seals.

concept.title: Tilkobling av det hydrauliske systemet

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Flytt ikke tilhengeren dersom hydraulikkslangene er koblet fra. Det kan forårsake skader på maskineriet.
Hvis du flytter tilhengeren med en traktor, koble til alle slanger og kabler selv om du ikke bruker trekkraftsystemet.
Når du kobler hydraulikkslangene fra traktoren, koble dem alltid til hurtigkoblingene på parkeringsstøtten til tilhengeren.
Hvis du flytter tilhengeren med en gaffeltruck eller tilsvarende under lagring, kontroller at hydraulikkslangene er koblet til hurtigkoblingene på parkeringsstøtten.

note.p: Hvis hydraulikksystemene til traktoren og tilhengeren ikke er koblet til, finnes det flere alternativer for tilhengerhydraulikkoljen. Se i kapittel for oljeanbefalinger.

Rengjør traktorens hydrauliske system før du kobler til hydraulikkslangene til tilhengeren. Smuss og andre partikler i hydraulikkoljen kan føre til at komponenter slites raskere enn vanlig. De kan også forårsake midlertidige feil (f.eks. blokkering i oljekanalene eller blokkering av ventilspindlene) og komponentskade.

concept.title: Hydraulic hoses

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Incorrect connection or use can cause damage to the hydraulic components.

ul.li: Before you connect the hydraulic pressure hoses directly to the tractor, make sure that the tractor has a 2-way power take-off.
Make sure that the hydraulic components are compatible with the tractor hydraulics.
Make sure that the hydraulic oil in the tractor is compatible with the hydraulic oil in the trailer. Refer to for the oil used at the factory.
Make sure that you connect the trailer's hydraulic hoses to the tractor's hydraulics correctly.
With the disc brakes, if the tractor does not have a valve for the brake, use the brakes' 0-pressure valve
With the disc brakes, if the brake pressure that comes from the tractor is more than 140 bar, you must always use the brake pressure reducer.

conbody.p:
You must connect the hydraulic hoses to the quick couplings on the parking leg when the trailer is not attached to the tractor. This helps to prevent damage to the machinery and keeps the hoses clean.
Open the drain valve on the parking leg to drain any oil that collects in it at regular intervals.
Do not let the parking leg to hit anything during storage.

task.title: Install the loader control panel

step.cmd: Lift the loader control panel in the tractor cabin adjacent to the rear window. Install the control panel rod to the cabin A-pillars with bolts.
Turn the locking levers to open them.
Move the control panel to the left or right until it is in correct position.
Close the locking levers to lock the control panel in position.
Attach the cable socket plate to the top link connection point at the rear of the tractor. Lock the cable socket plate in position with the top link pin and a linchpin.
Refer to for the cable installation instructions.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Innkjøringsinspeksjon for lasteren

conbody.p: Sørg for at innkjøringsinspeksjonen utføres for lasteren på følgende måte:

ul.li: før første innkjøring
før lasteren brukes etter sikkerhetskritiske reparasjoner eller modifikasjoner

conbody.p: Innkjøringsinspeksjonen må omfatte prosedyrene som angis i protokollen for innkjøringsinspeksjon. Innkjøringsinspeksjonen omfatter

ul.li: en inspeksjon av deler og utstyr relatert til sikkerhet
en belastningstest i henhold til EN 12999-standarden eller produsentens instruksjoner
en inspeksjon av stabilitet i stående tilstand (EN 12999), om nødvendig

conbody.p: Hvis et kontrollsystem som benytter kontaktløs (elektromagnetisk) dataoverføring, installeres på lasteren, må det alltid inspiseres. Dette gjelder for nye og brukte lastere.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Fullstendig, periodisk inspeksjon av lasteren

conbody.p: I tillegg til årlige inspeksjoner må det utføres en fullstendig, periodisk inspeksjon på lasteren i henhold til nasjonale forskrifter, eller maksimalt 10 år etter første innkjøring.

Ta hensyn til følgende ved beregning av det korrekte tidspunktet for fullstendige, periodiske inspeksjoner:
bruksintensiteten
skader som er oppdaget under de årlige inspeksjonene
reparasjoner som er utført på lasteren
mulige typefeil i lasteren
Under den fullstendige, periodiske inspeksjonen må enkelte sikkerhetsrelaterte deler av enheten demonteres for å undersøke anvendeligheten. Inspeksjonsmetodene som benyttes, må være ikke-destruktive.

concept.title: Annual inspection

conbody.p: If the trailer is in operation, do the annual inspection of the trailer frequently, a minimum of once a year.

If the loader is in operation, do the annual inspection and the related test run once a year at the minimum (or according to national regulations). A test run specified in standard EN 12999 (or an equivalent test run) must be done at four-year intervals. In the annual inspection, the loader is examined for material fatigue, wear, corrosion and other damage that is the result of use. The loader structure is examined for changes that can have an effect on safety.

concept.title: Daglig inspeksjon og vedlikehold

ul.li: Ikke betjen lasteren hvis den er skadet eller defekt.

conbody.p: Før drift av lasteren må du utføre prosedyren for daglig vedlikehold for å kontrollere at det er trygt å sette lasteren i drift. Se for informasjon om prosedyren.

concept.title: Inspector

conbody.p: The inspector of the trailer must know the trailer structure and its operation.

The inspector of the loader must know the loader structure, its operation and the inspection procedures. Only a certified inspector is permitted to do the commissioning inspection, annual inspection and full periodic inspection.

concept.title: Inspection

conbody.p: Refer to for the necessary safety precautions. The same safety instructions are applicable for inspections and normal operation.

ul.li: Make sure that the standing stability of the trailer and loader is good during the test.
Do not let other persons come near the trailer and the loader during the inspection.
Do not go below the trailer or the loader during the inspection. Be careful when you are near the trailer.
Obey the safety distance from power lines.

task.title: Hydraulic hoses and pipes

step.cmd: Examine the hydraulic hoses for wear and damage that could cause them to break.
Examine the hydraulic connections and pipes for cracks and distortion that could cause them to break suddenly.
Examine the protection of hoses.
Examine the movements of hoses in the different positions of the articulated drawbar and the loader booms.
If you find damage, repair the trailer or the loader before operation.

Undersøk strukturene for uautoriserte endringer og reparasjonssveising.

task.title: Brakes

step.cmd: Examine the brakes for changes that could be dangerous. For example, make sure that the hydraulic hoses have the correct pressure rating.
Examine the hydraulic and supply hoses for wear and damage that could cause them to break.
Examine the hydraulic and supply hose connections and pipes for cracks, distortion and leaks that could cause them to break suddenly.
Examine the protection of hoses.
Examine the movements of hoses in the various positions of the bogie arms.
Examine the brake pads for wear that could make the brakes weaker.
Examine the brake discs for wear that could make the brakes weaker.

concept.title: Operation

conbody.p: Read the before you operate the trailer or the loader.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Be careful around the trailer. If the trailer is parked on a slope, it can move and crush a person. It will cause serious injury or death.
Engage the parking brake.
Be very careful when you do work near the turning trailer parts. Loose clothes, tools or long hair can wind around them. It will cause serious injury or death.
Make sure that the covers on the cardan shaft are not damaged. Attach the locking chains carefully.
Do not go in the danger area near the articulated drawbar.

Do not park the trailer or operate it on a slope if its angle is more than the maximum permitted angle. The maximum permitted angle is 18 degrees. If the angle of the slope is more than the maximum permitted angle, the trailer is not stable and can tilt suddenly. It will cause serious injury or death.
Be very careful when you operate the trailer on slippery surfaces. Do not put too much load on the trailer or drive too fast.
Do not tilt the tipping platform up near overhead power lines. Electric shock will cause serious injury or death.
Obey the safety distance to the power lines.

Be very careful when you move the platform or the loader after commissioning, maintenance, repairs and equivalent. There can be air in the hydraulic system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements. These movements will cause serious injury or death.
Do not lift a load above persons with the loader. The load can fall and cause serious injury or death.
Before you lift a load, make sure that there are no persons in the danger area.
The minimum safety distance during operation is 25 m (82 ft) when you use the loader.
Do not put too much weight on the trailer. The load can fall and cause serious injury or death.
Make sure that you attach the load to the trailer with load straps.
Do not touch high-voltage wires with the loader. It will cause serious injury or death.
When you operate the loader near power lines, obey the safety distances.
If the voltage of the power line is 110 kV or more, the minimum safety distance is 5 m.
If the fixing screws of the loader or the slewing mechanism break, it will cause serious injury or death.
Always use fixing screws and other fastening supplies recommended in the manual.
Examine the tightness of the fixing screws regularly.
Before you start to operate the trailer, make sure that all persons are outside the minimum safety distance from the trailer.
The safety distance during operation is 25 m (82 ft).
Do not put your hands or other parts of the body below the load. It can cause serious injury or death.
Do not put your fingers or hands between the tailgate and the platform. It can cause serious injury.
Be very careful when you do work near the platform.
Stop the engine before you do work in the danger area of the platform. Make sure that there are no other persons in the danger area.
Be very careful when you drive on public roads. The trailer can get caught and stop on soft roads.
Be very careful when you drive on public roads. A slow-moving vehicle can cause danger on the roads.
Make sure that all the necessary equipment, for example lights and reflectors, are serviceable.
Do not lift persons with the loader. It can cause serious injury or death.
Be very careful when you do work on the platform. You can fall to the ground. It can cause injury or death.
If you see a leak in a hydraulic hose, do not go near it. Defective hydraulic hoses can spray oil with high pressure. Oil spray is dangerous to the skin and eyes.
If an accident occurs, get medical aid immediately.

Examine the condition of hydraulic hoses regularly. Move, for example, a piece of cardboard along the hoses to find possible small leaks. Replace worn or damaged hydraulic hoses before you use the trailer.

ul.li: Be very careful when you attach the trailer to the tractor.
You can become pinched between the tractor and the trailer structures. It can cause serious injury or material damage.
If it is not necessary, do not go between the tractor and the trailer.
Be very careful when you operate the hydraulic articulated drawbar.
The trailer stability decreases on a slope. If you turn the drawbar downhill and park the trailer on a slope, the trailer can tilt. It can cause serious injury or material damage.
Do not use the hydraulic drawbar control if other persons are near the trailer.
Do not operate the trailer before you read the operation and safety instructions.
Do not put too much load on the trailer.
Do not transport persons on the trailer.
Do not compress the load with the loader.
Do not operate the loader if it is damaged or defective.
Do not operate the loader if you are under 18 years old.
Do not operate the loader if your hearing or eyesight is poor.

Make sure that you read and understand the operation, maintenance and safety instructions before you operate the machinery or do maintenance on it. If you do not have sufficient information on the operation and properties of the machinery, there is a risk of injury or death. Only approved persons are permitted to operate the machinery, do maintenance on the machinery or make adjustments to it.
KESLA multipurpose trailer is made for transportation of sand, gravel and other loose material, timber transportation from the forest and general cargo transportation.
Only approved persons are permitted to operate the trailer.
Make sure that the load on the trailer is not more than the maximum permitted load of the tractor tow hook.
Make sure that the trailer drawbar eye is locked to the tractor tow hook.
Make sure that the articulated drawbar is serviceable.
Obey the maintenance instructions.
Vehicle noise can damage your hearing and cause deafness.
Use applicable hearing protection when necessary.
The noise level at the work site is different if the sound proofing of the tractor you use with the trailer is different.

Always put on applicable personal protective equipment before you operate the machinery. These can include a safety helmet, protective clothing, safety footwear, hearing protection, safety glasses and other protective equipment applicable to your task.

concept.title: General information about operation

conbody.p:
These operation instructions include the instructions that follow:
Safety instructions at the work site
Select the work area
General instructions
Emergency stop
Instructions on how to attach the trailer to the tractor and how to remove it from the tractor
Operation of the trailer
Operation of the loader
Instructions on how to open and close the sideboards and the tailgate
Transport timber from the forest
Transport and unload gravel and other loose materials
Transport general cargo
Road traffic
Install and remove the material gripper
Storage of tools and accessories.

ul.li: Make sure that you read and understand the operation, maintenance and safety instructions before you operate the machinery or do maintenance on it. If you do not have sufficient information on the operation and properties of the machinery, there is a risk of injury or death. Only approved persons are permitted to operate the machinery, do maintenance on the machinery or make adjustments to it.

Always put on applicable personal protective equipment before you operate the machinery. These can include a safety helmet, protective clothing, safety footwear, hearing protection, safety glasses and other protective equipment applicable to your task.

conbody.p: A good knowledge of operation and careful maintenance are very important for occupational safety. In addition, they help you get the best performance from your trailer and loader. Before you operate the trailer or the loader, make sure that you understand every section of this manual. Obey all instructions given in this manual. If you are not sure what the instructions mean, contact your dealer.
Each loader is different to use. Practice before you do work with the loader.

section.title: Safety instructions at the work site

ul.li: Before you start the work, make sure that no persons, animals or items are in the danger area of the loader or the trailer.
Use the stabilizer legs on the loader to make sure that the vehicle is stable.

Always engage the parking brake of the tractor before you use the loader. Keep the parking brakes engaged during loading. If necessary, put the wheel chocks in front of the wheels. They are attached to the front screen of the trailer.
If the ground below is soft or the trailer is parked on a slope, make sure that the vehicle is stable. Be very careful when you operate the hydraulic articulated drawbar.
Make sure that you can see the whole working area.
If you go away from the vehicle, always stop the engine and take the key with you.
Obey the safety distances when you operate the vehicle near power lines.
Do not do sudden movements with the loader.
Do not turn the loader with the maximum speed.
Do not operate the loader when the tractor or the trailer moves.

concept.title: Velge arbeidsområdet

conbody.p: Planlegg arbeidet nøye på forhånd. Kontroller at det er trygt å bruke tilhengeren i arbeidsområdet.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Start to operate the trailer and the loader

step.cmd: Attach the trailer to the tractor. Refer to .
Make sure that the hydraulic pressure is not connected to the trailer.
Start the tractor engine.
Start the power take-off.
Connect the hydraulic pressure to the trailer.
Let the pump circulate the oil in the valve block before you start to use the loader or the trailer.
Slowly operate all the cylinders of the loader and the trailer fully in and out to make the gaskets more flexible. This is very important in low temperatures.

The lowest recommended operating temperature is -25 °C. In lower temperatures the hydraulic gaskets wear faster, the risk of brittle fracture in steel structures increases, and the hoses can become damaged. If you operate the trailer and loader in temperatures below -25 °C, lift smaller loads than normal loads to prevent damage.
Make sure that the trailer brakes operate correctly.
Put the tailgate hinges in the operation position on the work site. Refer to for the instructions.

Drive the vehicle smoothly. Do not make sudden movements or changes in direction when you operate the trailer or the loader. Smooth operation makes the work safe and satisfactory, and additional repairs are not necessary.
Make sure that you know the movements and positions of the articulated drawbar. There is a risk that the front of the trailer hits an object or a person. It can also cause a crush hazard.
Make sure that you know the movements and positions of the loader. The loader can hit the tractor cabin or other parts of the tractor.
Put the wheel chocks in front of the wheels before you start to load the trailer. They are attached to the front screen of the trailer.
Adjust the stabilizer legs until the loader is in vertical position.
Load the trailer correctly and carefully. Refer to .
If the ground is soft or slippery, lift the load near the ground until the load is near the trailer. Then lift the load into the trailer.
If the vehicle starts to tilt, lower the load to the ground as quickly as possible.

concept.title: Nødstopp

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Hvis lasteren begynner å tippe over, senker du kloen og lasten til bakken.
Ikke hopp ut av traktorens førerhytte. Lasten, traktoren eller lasteren kan falle over deg. Dette vil forårsake alvorlige ulykker eller dødsfall.
Hvis du oppdager en lekkasje i en hydraulikkslange, må du ikke gå i nærheten av den. Olje under høyt trykk kan sprute ut fra defekte hydraulikkslanger. Oljesprut er farlig for huden og øynene.
Oppsøk lege umiddelbart hvis det oppstår en ulykke.
Undersøk tilstanden på hydraulikkslangene regelmessig, for eksempel med en kartongbit. Skift ut slitte eller skadde hydraulikkslanger før du bruker hengeren.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Senk lasten hvis kjøretøyet begynner å tippe over
task.abstract: Gjør følgende hvis lasteren eller kjøretøyet begynner å tippe over:

step.cmd: Senk umiddelbart kloen og lasten til bakken. Ikke stopp lasten i luften.
Ikke senk lasten med den ytre bommen, ettersom lasten kan knuse førerhyttevinduet og slå i deg.
Hvis traktoren begynner å tippe over, følger du instruksjonene i traktorens førerhytte. Ikke hopp ut av førerhytten, ettersom lasten, traktoren eller lasteren kan falle over deg.
Koble fra batteriet etter at traktoren har tippet over for å forhindre brann.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Nødstopp ved brudd på en slange
task.abstract: Gjør følgende ved brudd på en hydraulikkslange eller et rør:

step.cmd: Senk lasten til bakken.
Stopp traktormotoren.
Koble fra kraftuttaket.
Kontroller at det ikke er trykk i hydraulikksystemet.
Skift ut de skadde delene.
Fjern oljesølet fra bakken. Lever oljen til et innsamlingssted for avfallsolje.

concept.title: Attach and remove the trailer

conbody.p: This chapter contains instructions on how to attach the trailer to the tractor and how to remove the trailer from the tractor.

TranslationLock.Head: Attach and remove the trailer, submodules

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Attach the trailer to the tractor

taskbody.context: To attach the trailer to the tractor, do the steps that follow:

step.cmd: Lower the tractor's tow hook below the level of the trailer's drawbar eye.
Move the tractor rearward to put the tow hook to the center of the trailer's drawbar eye.
Lift the tow hook through the drawbar eye to lock it.
Engage the parking brake of the tractor.
Make sure that the hydraulic pressure is disconnected.
Stop the tractor engine.
Connect a cardan shaft to the trailer and to the tractor's power take-off.
Connect the trailer light cable to the tractor. If the loader control panel is in the tractor cabin, connect the trailer light cable to the control panel. Refer to .
Before you connect the hoses, make sure that the quick couplings of the hoses are clean.
Connect the brake hose to the tractor.
Connect the tipping platform hose to the tractor.
Connect the drawbar hoses to the tractor.
Remove the parking leg.
Attach the parking leg to the trailer frame and lock it in position.
Remove the wheel chocks that are in front of the trailer's wheels.
Start the tractor engine.
Make sure that the quick couplings of the hydraulic hoses are connected correctly.
Make sure that the tractor brakes are serviceable.
Make sure that the tractor and trailer lights are serviceable.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Remove the trailer from the tractor

taskbody.context: To remove the trailer from the tractor, do the steps that follow:

step.cmd: Make sure that the tipping platform is fully down.
Stop the tractor engine and engage the parking brake of the tractor.
Stop the power take-off of the tractor.
Make sure that the hydraulic pressure is disconnected.
Put wheel chocks in front of the trailer's wheels.
Remove the parking leg from the frame of the trailer.
Lock the parking leg to the drawbar to support the trailer.
Disconnect the electrical cables from the tractor or the loader control panel.
Disconnect the drawbar hoses from the tractor.
Disconnect the tipping platform hose from the tractor.
Disconnect the brake hose from the tractor.
Disconnect the cardan shaft from the tractor.
Start the tractor engine.
Lower the tractor's tow hook below the level of the trailer's drawbar eye.
Move the tractor forward.
Lift the tow hook to its usual position.
Put wheel chocks in front of the trailer's wheels.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Put the tailgate hinges to operation position

abstract.p: Put the tailgate hinges of the trailer to operation position before you start work on the work site.

step.cmd: Remove the bolts and the washers from the top hinge.
Push the top hinge to the left.
Install the washers and the bolts to the holes on the right side of the hinge. Tighten the bolts.
Loosen the bolts on top of the bottom hinge.
Remove the bolts and the washers from the bottom hinge.
Push the hinge to the left.
Install the washers and the bolts to the holes on the right side of the hinge. Tighten the bolts.
Tighten the bolts on top of the hinge.
