concept.title: Operation of the trailer

conbody.p: This chapter contains instruction on how to operate the hydraulic articulated drawbar, drive hydraulics and rear traction.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Operation of hydraulic articulated drawbar
task.abstract: When you use the hydraulic articulated drawbar, the trailer follows the tractor tracks. This prevents the damage to the remaining trees in the forest.

step.cmd: Be very careful when you turn the drawbar downhill on a slope, because the trailer can tilt. The risk increases if the trailer is empty.
Turn the drawbar uphill to make the trailer more stable.
Use the drawbar to go around the rocks and stumps. This makes the trailer more stable.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Operation of drive hydraulics

step.cmd: Set the drive hydraulics off when you drive on roads. If your trailer has brakes, the operating line pressure increases when you use the brakes and the hydraulic motors start. This decreases the brake force and the brakes will wear faster.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Operation of rear traction
task.abstract:
Because in most tractors the hydraulic pumps have stable output, you must not let the trailer to push the tractor. If the trailer pushes the tractor, part of the pump output goes through the pressure relief valve and back to the tank. This causes the oil to become hot quickly. The rear traction switch
To operate the rear traction, do the steps that follow:

step.cmd: Select the driving direction (forward/rearward) and activate the rear traction with the rear traction switch.
Find the gear from your tractor that is synchronized with the rear traction (also with the motor rotation speed). If the tractor's traction is too slow, the trailer's wheels will not hold.
Do not let the trailer to push the tractor.
Only operate the rear traction intermittently. Long operation time of the rear traction causes the oil to become hot and can cause the wheels to wear quickly.
If you do not need more power or you drive faster, put the rear traction switch to the middle position.

concept.title: Operation of the loader

conbody.p: This chapter contains information about the loader controls and CE equipment.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Connect the loader control panel

abstract.p: The loader control panel is installed in the tractor cabin adjacent to the rear window. Refer to for the installation instructions.

row.entry: Work light socket for the loader

step.cmd: Connect the trailer light cable to the trailer light socket (1).
Connect the drive cable to the drive cable socket (2)
Connect the loader cable to the loader cable socket (3).
Connect the work light cable to the work light socket (4).

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Loader controls

conbody.p: You can control the loader with the loader control panel. The loader control panel is installed in the tractor cabin adjacent to the rear window. The control panel has two joysticks, a stop button, a mode selection switch, a loader activation switch and a work light switch.
If you do not use the loader, you can stow the control panel in the trailer toolbox that has no shelves.

section.title: Stop button
section.p: The stop button disconnects the electricity and opens the dump valve. It is not an emergency stop.

section.title: Loader activation button
section.p: You can activate the loader control system from this button after you select the loader control mode from the mode selection switch.

section.title: Mode selection switch
section.p:
Select the operation mode from the mode selection switch:
In drive mode, the traction is engaged for the trailer but you cannot use the loader controls.
In loader control mode, you can use the loader controls. You must select the drive mode before you turn your seat to the front and drive the vehicle.

section.title: Work light switch
section.p: The work lights are off when the work light switch is in the 0 position.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Start the loader control system

note.p: It is very important that you do the steps below in the correct sequence.

step.cmd: Connect the cables to the loader control panel.
Start the tractor.
Make sure that the mode selection switch of the control panel is in the drive mode position. Refer to .
Make sure that the rear traction switch is in the middle position (rear traction is OFF). Refer to .
Start the power take-off.
Let the pump circulate oil in the valve block before you start to use the loader.
When you are ready to operate the loader, turn your seat to the rear to get access to the control panel.
Select the loader control mode from the mode selection switch on the control panel.
Push the loader activation button on the control panel to activate the loader control system. A green light comes on above the activation button when the loader is activated.
Slowly operate all the cylinders of the loader fully in and out to make the gaskets more flexible. This is very important in low temperatures.

Before you turn your seat to the front after loading, select the drive mode from the mode selection switch on the control panel. This is very important if you drive the tractor and use the rear traction of the trailer while the loader control system is activated.

concept.title: CE equipment

conbody.p: CE equipment is installed on the loader.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Load indicator

conbody.p: The CE load indicator on the loader shows the level of load to the operator. The system measures the pressure during lifting, and the indicator light comes on. The indicator light has three colors. Each color identifies a different level of load.

row.entry: The load is 100% of the maximum load.
The load is near the maximum capacity of the loader, 90% of the maximum load. The load cannot be much heavier.

conbody.p: If the light is red, decrease the load immediately. Retract the extensions or decrease the load to be lifted.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Height and stabilizer indicator

conbody.p: The lift boom has a sensor which monitors the angle of the boom. If the height is more than the maximum height, a red indicator light comes on. Do not drive the vehicle if the height indicator light is red.
The stabilizer indicator light comes on when you extend the stabilizers. Do not drive the vehicle if the stabilizer indicator light is red.

step.cmd: Open the latches on the sideboard.

Unfold the foothold.
Put your foot in the foothold and climb carefully on the platform.

concept.title: Open and close the one-part tailgate

conbody.p: If the trailer has an one-part tailgate (no hydraulic tailgate), obey the instructions that follow.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Open the one-part tailgate before you tilt the platform

taskbody.context: Open the tailgate from the bottom before you tilt the platform up to unload it.

step.cmd: Make sure that the tailgate hinges are in the operation position. Refer to .
Make sure that the locking pin is installed in the hinge on the top right corner of the tailgate.
Open the tailgate latch on the right side of the tailgate.
Remove the linchpin from the hinge pin on the left side of the tailgate.
Remove the hinge pin from the hinge.
Put the hinge pin into storage in the hole on the right side of the hinge.
Attach the linchpin to the hinge pin.

task.title: Open the one-part tailgate to the side

step.cmd: Make sure that the tailgate hinges are in the operation position. Refer to .
Make sure that the hinge pin and linchpin are installed in the hinge on the left side of the tailgate.
Open the tailgate latch on the right side of the tailgate.
Remove the locking pin from the hinge on the top right corner of the tailgate. Turn the locking pin to remove it.
Pull the tailgate to open it.
Turn the tailgate adjacent to the sideboard.
Attach the tailgate hook to the bolt on the beam between the sideboards.

Close the tailgate latch.

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Do not put your fingers or hands between the hydraulic bottom tailgate and the platform. It can cause serious injury.
Make sure that there are no persons near the hydraulic bottom tailgate when you open or close it.
Stop the engine before you do work in the danger area of the platform. Make sure that there are no other persons in the danger area.
Be very careful when you do work near the platform.

conbody.p: If the trailer has a two-part tailgate with a top tailgate and a hydraulic bottom tailgate, obey the instructions that follow. The hydraulic bottom tailgate is an accessory to the multipurpose trailer.

task.title: Open the two-part tailgate before you tilt the platform

taskbody.context: The top tailgate is usually always open and turns freely on the top hinges when the hydraulic bottom tailgate is installed to the trailer platform. If the top tailgate is closed, do the steps that follow to open it:

step.cmd: Make sure that the tailgate hinges are in the operation position. Refer to .
Make sure that there are no persons near the tailgate.
Open the hydraulic bottom tailgate from the tractor cabin.
Make sure that the locking pin is installed in the hinge on the top right corner of the tailgate.
Remove the linchpin from the hinge pin on the left side of the tailgate.
Remove the hinge pin from the hinge.
Put the hinge pin into storage in the hole on the right side of the hinge.
Attach the linchpin to the hinge pin.

task.title: Open the top tailgate to the side

step.cmd: Make sure that the tailgate hinges are in the operation position. Refer to .
Make sure that there are no persons near the tailgate.
Open the hydraulic bottom tailgate from the tractor cabin.
Install the hinge pin to the side hinge of the top tailgate. You can find the hinge pin in the hole adjacent to the hinge.
Install the linchpin to the hinge pin.
Remove the locking pin from the hinge on the top right corner of the tailgate. Turn the locking pin to remove it.
Pull the top tailgate to the side to open it.
Turn the tailgate adjacent to the sideboard.
Attach the tailgate hook to the bolt on the beam between the sideboards.

step.cmd: Push the top tailgate to close it.
Install the locking pin in the hinge on the top right corner of the tailgate.
Make sure that there are no persons near the tailgate.
Close the hydraulic bottom tailgate from the tractor cabin.

task.title: Use the ladders

note.p: Lock the ladder in the transport position before you move the trailer.

taskbody.context: The trailer has ladders at the rear and on the left and right side of the platform. The ladders are locked in the transport position below the platform.

step.cmd: Pull the lever up to open the lock.
Pull the ladder out. The ladder turns down into a 45-degree angle.
Be very careful when you climb the ladder onto the platform.
Before you drive the vehicle, lift the ladder up and push it below the platform.
Make sure that the lever locks the ladder in the transport position.

task.title: Transportere tømmer fra skogen

step.cmd: Planlegg kjørerutene nøye på forhånd.
Foreta tømmerlastingen på et jevnt og stabilt underlag.
Plasser stokkestablene på områder hvor du har tilstrekkelig plass til å laste. Sørg for at du ikke skader trærne i skogen.
Kontroller at du planlegger svingområdene riktig i skogen. Det må være tilstrekkelig plass til å snu kjøretøyet.
Planlegg kjørerutene så rette som mulig. Dette forhindrer skader på gjenstående trær i skogen.
Kontroller at kjøretøyet står stabilt når du laster stokker i skråninger og på mykt underlag.

task.title: Install the posts for timber transportation

abstract.p: The posts are stowed below the platform at the rear of the trailer. The posts are locked below the platform with chains.
Install the posts into the holes on each side of the platform before you transport timber. You can also install posts in the holes in middle of the platform to make two compartments for timber.

step.cmd: Turn the tailgate to the side. Refer to or for instructions.
Open the snap hooks and remove the chains.
Remove the plugs from the holes on the left and right side the platform.
Put the plugs into a toolbox.
Lower a post into a hole in the platform.
Turn the post until the horizontal bar in the hole goes into the slot on the post.
Do steps 5 and 6 again for the other posts.
Remove the posts from the holes after you complete timber transportation.
Put the plugs into the holes.
Stow the posts below the platform.
Lock the posts below the platform with the chains.

conbody.p: This chapter contains instructions on how to tilt the tipping platform and spread gravel.

task.abstract: If the trailer has an one-part tailgate, open and close the tailgate manually.

step.cmd: Open the tailgate before you tilt the platform. Refer to for instructions.
Lift the platform with the tipping mechanism and drive forward. Refer to for instructions.
When the platform is empty, lower it and close the tailgate. Refer to for instructions.

task.title: Spread gravel with the two-part tailgate

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Do not put your fingers or hands between the hydraulic bottom tailgate and the platform. It can cause serious injury.
Make sure that there are no persons near the hydraulic bottom tailgate when you open or close it.
Stop the engine before you do work in the danger area of the platform. Make sure that there are no other persons in the danger area.
Be very careful when you do work near the platform.

abstract.p: If the trailer has a two-part tailgate, you can use the hydraulic bottom tailgate to spread sand, gravel or other loose material.

step.cmd: Make sure that there are no persons near the tailgate.
Open the hydraulic bottom tailgate from the tractor cabin.
Make sure that the top tailgate can open on the top hinges. If it does not open, refer to for instructions how to open the top tailgate.
Lift the platform with the tipping mechanism and drive forward. Refer to for instructions.
Lower the platform when it is empty.
Close the hydraulic bottom tailgate.

task.title: Tilt the tipping platform

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Do not tilt the tipping platform up near overhead power lines. Electric shock will cause serious injury or death.
Obey the safety distance to the power lines.
Do not do go below the tipping platform when it is tilted up. The tipping platform can come down and cause serious injury or death.
Always operate the tipping platform up and down from the tractor cabin.
Do not put your fingers or hands between the hydraulic bottom tailgate and the platform. It can cause serious injury.
Make sure that there are no persons near the hydraulic bottom tailgate when you open or close it.
Stop the engine before you do work in the danger area of the platform. Make sure that there are no other persons in the danger area.
Be very careful when you do work near the platform.

step.cmd: Retract the loader booms and fold the outer boom against the lift boom. Make sure that the tipping platform does not hit the loader when you tilt it up.
Make sure that there are no power or telephone lines near the machinery.
Make sure that the tailgate can open.
Make sure that there are no persons or vehicles near or behind the platform.
Tilt the tipping platform with tractor hydraulics from the tractor cabin.
If necessary, drive forward to unload gravel or other loose materials from the platform.
Before you drive below an overpass, lightpoles, overhead signboards or equivalent, make sure that they are not too low.
When the platform is empty, lower the tipping platform. Make sure that the tipping platform is fully down on the trailer frame.

task.title: Transport general cargo

abstract.p: The capacity of the platform is 8 pallets (FIN). You can use the lifters (accessory) to lift pallets with the loader. Do not install a hook to the loader. It is not permitted.

step.cmd: Load pallets on the trailer platform with the front loader of the tractor or the with the lifters.
Load other general cargo with the front loader of the tractor or equivalent.
Always attach the load carefully to the trailer with load straps. Refer to for the location of load strap points.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Assemble and use the lifters

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Do not let other persons help you when you use the lifters. The lifters or a pallet can fall and cause serious injury or death.
Be very careful when you lift pallets with the lifters.
Make sure that there are no persons on the platform or near the trailer.
Ikke løft last over personer. Lasten kan falle og forårsake alvorlige ulykker eller dødsfall.
Før du løfter en last, må du kontrollere at det ikke oppholder seg personer i fareområdet.
Sikkerhetsavstanden som minst må overholdes under drift, er 25 m.

abstract.p: Lifters are an accessory.
You can use the lifters and lifting slings to lift pallets on the trailer platform.

step.cmd: Install the limiters to the left and right end of a post. Refer to for the location of the posts.
Push the post through the holes in the lifter plates.
Install the limiter plates to the left and right end of the post.
Push a locking pin through the hole on each limiter.
Install linchpins to the locking pins.
Open the loader grapple.
Position the grapple between the lifters.
Close the grapple slowly around the post.
Close the mechanical valve on the grapple.
Move the grapple above the pallet.
Put two lifting slings below the pallet and pull them to the other side.
Attach the ends of the first lifting sling to the lifting points on the left and right side of the lifter. Do this again for the second lifting sling.
Make sure that the lifting slings are at the bottom of the lifting slot on the lifter.
Make sure that latches lock the lifting sling to the lifter.
Before you lift the pallet, make sure that there are no other persons near the trailer or on the platform. Obey the safety distance of 25 m.
Lift the pallet on the trailer platform.
Remove the lifting slings carefully. Do not let other persons help you.

concept.title: Transport the ground drill

conbody.p: The trailer has a transport rack for the ground drill. The parts of the transport rack are stored on the trailer.
Transport the ground drill on the rack only for short distances (max. 5 km). If you transport the ground drill for longer distances, attach the ground drill on the trailer platform with load straps.

TranslationLock.Head: Transport the ground drill, optio, submodules

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Assemble the transport rack

abstract.p: The transport track has six main parts: two horizontal steel tubes, two vertical steel tubes and two end flanges. The parts are assembled into a transport rack with bolts and locking pins.

step.cmd: Open the snap hooks and remove the chains to get access to the transport rack parts.
Remove the four steel tubes from below the platform. They are different color than the posts.
Get the end flanges from the trailer toolbox.
Push the horizontal steel tubes in the transport rack holes below the trailer.
Lock the horizontal steel tubes in position with the locking pins and linchpins.
Install the vertical steel tubes on top of the horizontal steel tubes with bolts.
Tighten the bolts with an end flange. The end flanges have a hole for the bolts.
Install the end flanges to the horizontal steel tubes. Turn the end flanges until they stop. The transport rack is now ready for use.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Lift the ground drill on the transport rack

step.cmd: Turn the mechanical locking bar below the platform to lock the tipping platform. The locking bar is in front of the platform.
Lift the ground drill above the transport rack with the grapple.
Align the drill with the center of the transport rack. Use the vertical steel tubes as guides to find the correct position for the drill.
Move the ground drill until the bottom plate of the drill lightly touches the vertical steel tubes.
Lower the ground drill on the transport rack while the bottom plate touches the vertical steel tubes. The drill is in position when it does not go lower.
Attach the ground drill to the vertical steel tubes with chains.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Use the boom transport support
task.abstract: Use the boom transport support when there is a load on the platform and you drive the tractor. The transport support is stowed below the platform at the rear of the trailer.

step.cmd: Remove the linchpin from the locking pin.
Remove the locking pin from the boom transport support.
Pull the transport support out.
Remove the plug from the second center hole at the rear.
Put the plug into the toolbox.
Lower the transport support into the hole in the platform.
Turn the transport support until the horizontal bar in the hole goes into the slot on the transport support.
Close the grapple.
Lower the boom on the transport support. It is not necessary to attach the grapple to the transport support.
Stow the transport support below the platform when you do not need it.
Lock the transport support in position with the locking pin and the linchpin.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Road traffic

ul.li: Make sure that the loader and the stabilizers are in their transport positions before you drive the vehicle.

step.cmd: Obey all road traffic rules and regulations when you drive on public roads.
Retract the booms.
Retract the extension until it is as short as possible.
If the trailer does not have a load, close the grapple and lower the grapple on the trailer platform.
If the trailer has a load, lower the boom on the boom transport support. Refer to for the instruction on how to install the boom transport support.
Always lower the boom against the boom transport support before you drive the vehicle. Do not drive the vehicle when only the hydraulic system keeps the booms up.
Put the stabilizers in the transport position. The system turns the stabilizers up. Make sure that no persons or objects are in the way when you put the stabilizers in the transport position.
Stop the hydraulic pump before you drive on the road.
Attach the load carefully with load straps. Refer to .
Put the tailgate hinges of the trailer to the road traffic position. Refer to for the instructions.
Make sure that the axle weights, the gross weight of the vehicle and the transport dimensions are not more than permitted.
Make sure that the booms and all other parts of the loader are below the maximum permitted height of the vehicle.
Before you drive the vehicle, make sure that all the necessary equipment, for example, lights, reflectors and warning devices are serviceable and in the correct position.
Before you drive the vehicle, make sure that the visibility from the cabin is good.
Before you drive the vehicle, make sure that there are no persons near and in the way of the vehicle.
Always obey laws and regulations when you drive.
Adapt the driving speed to the situation to make sure that you can always control the vehicle.
Adapt the driving speed and safety gaps to make sure that you have enough time and distance to brake.
Before you drive under power lines, telephone lines, a bridge or an overpass, make sure that they are not too low for the vehicle and the loader.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Put the tailgate hinges to road traffic position

abstract.p: Put the tailgate hinges of the trailer to road traffic position before you drive on the road:

step.cmd: Remove the bolts and the washers from the top hinge.
Push the top hinge to the right.
Install the washers and the bolts to the holes on the left side of the hinge. Tighten the bolts.
Loosen the bolts on top of the bottom hinge.
Remove the bolts and the washers from the bottom hinge.
Push the hinge to the right.
Install the washers and the bolts to the holes on the left side of the hinge. Tighten the bolts.
Tighten the bolts on top of the hinge.
step.info: The left side of the tailgate is now locked.

concept.title: Install and remove the material gripper

conbody.p: The material gripper is stowed below the platform in the rear part of the trailer.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Install the material gripper to the grapple

step.cmd: Remove the posts to get access to the material gripper.
Remove the linchpins from the brackets.
Pull the two halves of the material gripper out of the brackets.
Attach the linchpins to the brackets.
Stow the posts below the trailer platform again.
Lower the grapple until it is in the air approximately one meter above the ground.
Open the grapple fully.
Push the first half of the material gripper into the jaw of the grapple until the jaw is in the slot of the material gripper.
Install the material gripper to the jaw with the nuts and bolts.
Do steps 8 and 9 again to install the second half of the material gripper to the grapple.
Tighten the nuts. Refer to for the correct torque.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Remove the material gripper from the grapple

step.cmd: Lower the grapple until it is in the air approximately one meter above the ground.
Open the grapple fully.
Remove the nuts and bolts from the first half of the material gripper.
Remove the first half of the material gripper.
Do steps 3 and 4 again to remove the second half of the material gripper.
Remove the posts from below the trailer platform to get access to the storage location of the material gripper.
Remove the linchpins from the brackets.
Push the two halves of the material gripper into the brackets.
Attach the linchpins to the brackets.
Stow the posts below the trailer platform again.

concept.title: Use the beam gripper

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Be careful when you lift metal bridge parts. They can move in the grapple while you lift them and fall. It will cause serious injury, death or material damage.

sl.sli: Always obey the local regulations and the safety instructions of the structure and parts that you do work on.
Metal parts move easily on the platform. Make sure that the load is carefully attached to the trailer with load straps.

conbody.p: The multipurpose trailer and loader can be used to transport and move parts for temporary bridges and beam bridges. In military use, the loader can also be used in the installation of bridge parts. For this purpose, beam grippers can be installed to the material grippers. Their non-slip rubber pads prevent movement of metal parts. The beam grippers also help prevent damage to the surface of metal parts.

Examine the condition of the beam grippers before you use them. There must be no cracks or other damage. Also monitor the condition of mounting bolts and plastic parts during work. Replace these, if necessary.
If you cannot use the beam grippers, or it is not necessary to prevent surface damage, use the material gripper. Refer to .

The grapple has a mechanical valve for better safety when bridge parts are moved with the grapple. If you use the loader in the installation of bridge parts, make sure that the valve is in closed position.

task.title: Install the beam gripper
task.abstract: The beam gripper parts are installed together with the material gripper.

step.cmd: Push the first half of the material gripper into the jaw of the grapple until the jaw is in the slot of the material gripper.
Install the material gripper and the non-slip rubber pad to the grapple with bolts and washers.
Install the second half of the material gripper and the non-slip rubber pad.
Install the rubber rollers to the material gripper with bolts, washers and nuts.

task.title: Remove the beam gripper
task.abstract: The beam gripper parts and the material gripper are removed at the same time.

step.cmd: Remove the bolts, washers, nuts and rubber rollers from both halves of the material gripper.
Remove the bolts, washers and non-slip rubber pad from the first half of the material gripper.
Remove the first half of the material gripper.
Remove the bolts, washers and non-slip rubber pad from the second half of the material gripper.
Remove the second half of the material gripper.

concept.title: Maintenance

conbody.p: These maintenance instructions include the usual maintenance procedures and the necessary checks and adjustments. Regular maintenance keeps the trailer and loader serviceable for longer. Obey the maintenance instructions to keep the warranties valid.
Before you do maintenance or repairs on the trailer or the loader, do the steps that follow:

ul.li: Read the safety instructions in chapter .
Tell the operator of the trailer about the maintenance or repair work.
Make sure that the trailer is on a stable surface.
Lower the loader on the platform into the transport position. Refer to for instructions.
Stop the tractor engine.
Engage the parking brake.
Remove the tractor ignition key from the ignition switch.
Disconnect the hydraulic pressure from the trailer.
Clean the trailer and the loader.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: General maintenance instructions

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Do not do work below the tipping platform without the maintenance support. The tipping platform can come down and cause serious injury or death.
Always lift the maintenance support before you do work below the tipping platform while the tipping mechanism holds it up.
Put applicable supports below or around the loader components before you do maintenance or repairs.
A component in the hydraulic system can fall during maintenance or repairs. It will cause serious injury or death.

Be very careful when you move the platform or the loader after commissioning, maintenance, repairs and equivalent. There can be air in the hydraulic system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements. These movements will cause serious injury or death.
Vær svært forsiktig når du kobler fra hydraulikkslanger.
Ikke forsøk å finne lekkasjer med hånden. Olje under høyt trykk kan sprute ut fra defekte hydraulikkslanger.
Oljesprut er farlig for huden og øynene. Oppsøk lege umiddelbart hvis det oppstår en ulykke.
Ved bruk av olje og smørefett må du overholde de lokale forskriftene og instruksjonene fra olje- og fettprodusentene.
Send inn avfallsolje til passende behandling i henhold til lokale lover og forskrifter.
Olje og fett kan inneholde tilsetningsstoffer som kan være farlige for huden og miljøet.

Be careful not to get oil or grease on your skin. They contain solvents and additives that can be dangerous for your skin (the skin dries and cracks). Used, dirty oil or grease is more dangerous than new.
When you use oil and grease, obey the local regulations and the instructions of oil and grease manufacturers.
If oil or grease causes you dermatitis, inflammation or other skin reaction, get medical aid immediately.
Hvis du søler olje, må du umiddelbart fjerne den.
Send inn avfallsolje til passende behandling i henhold til lokale lover og forskrifter.
Olje og fett er farlig for miljøet.
Be very careful when you increase the tire pressure of old tires. Examine the tires before you increase the pressure.
Worn or old trailer tires can explode when the pressure increases. The explosion can cause serious injury or death.
Ikke endre trykkverdiene for ventilene i hydraulikksystemet.
Hold trykket i hydraulikksystemet under de tillatte verdiene. Hvis trykket er høyere enn de tillatte verdiene, kan det forårsake alvorlige personskader og alvorlige skader.

ul.li: Do not use clothes that have oil or grease on them.
If tools and other objects have oil or grease on them, do not put them in your pockets.
Do not clean your hands with lubricating oil or grease. Lubricants can contain metal particles and additives that can cause damage to your skin.

Make sure that you read and understand the operation, maintenance and safety instructions before you operate the machinery or do maintenance on it. If you do not have sufficient information on the operation and properties of the machinery, there is a risk of injury or death. Only approved persons are permitted to operate the machinery, do maintenance on the machinery or make adjustments to it.
Use applicable protective clothing and protective skin creams or applicable gloves when you use oil or grease. Be careful not to get oil or grease on your skin.
If oil or grease damages your skin, get medical aid immediately.
Do not clean the electrical components with a high-pressure washer.
If you clean the trailer with a high-pressure washer, make sure that the pressure is not too high.
If you use a high-pressure washer, make sure that water does not go into the joint bearings or into the joint between the pillar and the slewing mechanism.
Stop the engine and take the ignition key with you before you do adjustments or maintenance to the trailer or loader, clean the trailer, or go away from it.
Only use original parts to repair or to do maintenance on the mechanical transmission or hydraulics.
Send the waste oil for applicable processing. Obey the local laws and regulations.

note.p: To disassemble the trailer or loader or its components during the warranty period, only use maintenance workshops and maintenance personnel that the manufacturer approves.
To keep warranty valid, do maintenance work correctly and obey the instructions in this manual.

conbody.p: Read the maintenance instructions first. Incorrect maintenance can cause damage to the trailer or the loader.
All persons responsible for operation and maintenance of the trailer and the loader must know the information that follows.
The operator can do most of the KESLA loader maintenance tasks, because the necessary special tools are supplied with the loader.
Before you clean the loader, or do maintenance or repairs on the loader, lower the booms on the platform or use some other applicable support.
Before you clean the trailer or the loader, or do maintenance or repairs on them, put the trailer on a level surface.
Make sure that the weight of the loader parts is not on the cylinders.
Stop the tractor engine and the hydraulic unit if it is not necessary to operate the trailer or the loader during the maintenance procedure. Remove the tractor ignition key from the ignition switch.

Use an approved hoist with approved lifting equipment to lift the parts. Make sure that the hoist has a sufficient lifting capacity. Obey all local and on-site lifting precautions, procedures and regulations. Do not go below the loader or its parts during lifting or maintenance.
Always release the pressure in the hydraulic system before you open it or do other procedures to the hydraulic system.
Be very careful when you remove hydraulic pipes and hoses. Make sure that there is no hydraulic pressure in the line after you stop the tractor engine and the hydraulic unit.
When you open the hydraulic system, air goes into the system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements when you use the trailer and loader again.
Do the maintenance to the trailer and the loader at intervals specified in the maintenance schedule. Regular maintenance is important for safety and to keep the trailer serviceable.

The loader was carefully tested and adjusted before it was shipped from the factory. Do not change the pressure values of the valves from the values specified in the hydraulics diagram. It is not permitted, unless you get a written permission from the manufacturer. Only approved maintenance personnel is permitted to adjust and repair the valves.
Do not use the loader if it operates incorrectly. Find the cause of the malfunction and repair the loader. Also repair small defects, because they cause more damage. Refer to .
For easy maintenance, refer to the for periodic inspections and maintenance procedures. To find the cause of a malfunction, refer to .
To prevent malfunctions, obey the maintenance instructions. Clean the components carefully when you connect the hydraulic hoses or do maintenance on the hydraulic system.
Lubrication increases the service life of the machinery by decreasing friction and removing dirt and water.
Oil collects water and dirt that cause corrosion and wear. Change oil and drain water regularly to prevent these problems.
Keep the surfaces of the trailer and the loader clean to prevent corrosion.

task.title: Use the maintenance support of the tipping platform

abstract.p: Always use the maintenance support when you do maintenance work below the platform. The maintenance support is against the frame when it is not used.

step.cmd: Remove the boom transport support from the rear of the trailer:

substep.cmd: Remove the linchpin from the locking pin.
Remove the locking pin from the boom transport support.

step.cmd: Retract the booms of the loader. Then fold the outer boom against the lift boom. Make sure that the tipping platform does not hit the loader when you tilt it up.
Tilt the tipping platform with tractor hydraulics from the tractor cabin.
Before you do work below the platform, use the crank to turn the maintenance support in the direction of the tailgate until the maintenance support touches the platform.
When you stop work, turn the maintenance support against the frame and lower the tipping platform. Stow the boom transport support below the platform again.

Undersøk alle stålstrukturer og sveisesømmer etter belastningstesten. Påse at det ikke finnes rifter, sprekker eller annen permanent, farlig deformering.
Undersøk strukturene for å se etter ikke-godkjente endringer og reparasjonssveising.

abstract.p: Examine the screws and lock rings on the axles of the loader booms:

step.cmd: Make sure that the lock screws on the axle flanges are tight.
Make sure that the lock rings on the cylinder axles tight.

task.title: Hydraulic hoses and pipes

step.cmd: Examine the hydraulic hoses for wear and damage that could cause them to break.
Examine the hydraulic connections and pipes for cracks and distortion that could cause them to break suddenly.
Examine the protection of hoses.
Examine the movements of hoses in the different positions of the articulated drawbar and the loader booms.
If you find damage, repair the trailer or the loader before operation.

conbody.p: The given lubrication intervals are applicable when the trailer is operated in normal operating conditions and used for normal loads. Decrease the lubrication interval if the trailer is used for heavy loads or if the operating conditions are unfavorable (sand, dust, mud, etc).

concept.title: The hydraulic system

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Put applicable supports below or around the loader components before you do maintenance or repairs.
A component in the hydraulic system can fall during maintenance or repairs. It will cause serious injury or death.

Be very careful when you move the platform or the loader after commissioning, maintenance, repairs and equivalent. There can be air in the hydraulic system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements. These movements will cause serious injury or death.
Vær svært forsiktig når du kobler fra hydraulikkslanger.
Ikke forsøk å finne lekkasjer med hånden. Olje under høyt trykk kan sprute ut fra defekte hydraulikkslanger.
Oljesprut er farlig for huden og øynene. Oppsøk lege umiddelbart hvis det oppstår en ulykke.
Ikke endre trykkverdiene for ventilene i hydraulikksystemet.
Hold trykket i hydraulikksystemet under de tillatte verdiene. Hvis trykket er høyere enn de tillatte verdiene, kan det forårsake alvorlige personskader og alvorlige skader.

ul.li: Obey the safety instructions of the hydraulic system when you connect the hydraulics to the loader and operate the hydraulics.
Only persons trained in the maintenance and repairs of the hydraulic system are permitted to install components to the system and to do maintenance and repairs to the system.
Do not start a task if you are not sure that you can do it.
Refer to the specifications for the maximum permitted pressure of the hydraulic system.
Only use original spare parts for maintenance and repairs of the hydraulic system.
Only use parts with sufficient pressure resistance.

conbody.p: When you replace hydraulic hoses, couplings, seals and other hydraulic system components, use original KESLA spare parts for the best performance and safety.

Always use applicable hydraulic oil in the hydraulic system. Be careful with the storage and handling of the oil. In the hydraulic system, the oil is used for energy transmission and as a lubricant. To keep the trailer and loader in good operating condition, always use high-quality oil.

Always keep the hydraulic system of the vehicle clean. The hydraulic system must have a pressure filter and a return filter. The hydraulic system must also have a replaceable breather filter. It keeps dirt particles out of the hydraulic oil.
Obey the maintenance schedule and change the filters often. Also change the filters when you change the oil.

Changes in temperature cause condensation of water in the hydraulic system. Water can cause problems in operation, especially in the winter. To prevent problems, change the oil two times a year (in the spring and autumn) or more often.
Use petrol or white spirit to clean the oil tank. Do not use fuel oil.

concept.title: Trykkfilter

conbody.p: Når du skifter ut filterelementet for trykkfilteret, må du bruke et filterelement som leveres av KESLA.

Hvis du bruker et filterelement fra en annen leverandør, må du sørge for følgende:
Du bruker om mulig et filterelement som leveres av den opprinnelige filterprodusenten.
Filterelementet har korrekte dimensjoner.
Filterets absolutte filtreringsgrad er < 20 µm.
Hvis systemet har to filtre, må de to filterelementene skiftes ut samtidig.

concept.title: Hydraulic oils

conbody.p: The trailer is filled at the factory with this oil: .
The loader is filled at the factory with this oil: .
The loader contains approximately 14 liters of oil when delivered from the factory. The maximum oil capacity of the loader is between 15 and 25 liters, depending on the loader size.
When you select the hydraulic oil, obey the recommendations of the tractor manufacturer or the hydraulic system supplier.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Biologisk nedbrytbare hydraulikkoljer

conbody.p: Oljeprodusenter utvikler biologisk nedbrytbare oljer for å erstatte oljebaserte hydraulikkoljer. Biologisk nedbrytbare oljer er mindre skadelige for miljøet hvis oljen skulle lekke til bakken.

Du kan ikke gå direkte over fra oljebaserte oljer til biologisk nedbrytbare oljer. Endringer i hydraulikkutstyret (f.eks. pumpetetninger og hydraulikkslanger) er nødvendig før du kan bruke en biologisk nedbrytbar olje.
Biologisk nedbrytbare oljer er inndelt i tre hovedkategorier:

ul.li: Syntetiske hydraulikkoljer basert på estere (HEE)
Syntetiske hydraulikkoljer basert på polyglykoler (HEPG)
Hydraulikkoljer basert på vegetabilske oljer (HETG), for eksempel rapsolje
Ikke bruk HETG-oljer i KESLA-produkter.

Før du begynner å bruke en biologisk nedbrytbar olje, må du velge den aktuelle oljen hos oljeforhandleren. Kontroller at oljen er kompatibel med tetningene i hydraulikkpumpen og andre komponenter i hydraulikksystemet.

concept.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
concept.title: Change the oil in the hydraulic system

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Be very careful when you start the trailer after commissioning, maintenance, repairs and equivalent. There can be air in the hydraulic system. The air can cause sudden, unwanted movements of the trailer. These movements will cause serious injury or death.
Make sure that the hydraulic pressure is disconnected from the trailer when you start the engine.
Do not try to find a leak with your hand. Defective hydraulic hoses can spray oil with high pressure.
Oil spray is dangerous to the skin and eyes. If an accident occurs, get medical aid immediately.
Examine the condition of hydraulic hoses regularly. Replace worn or damaged hydraulic hoses before you use the trailer.
Ikke endre trykkverdiene for ventilene i hydraulikksystemet.
Hold trykket i hydraulikksystemet under de tillatte verdiene. Hvis trykket er høyere enn de tillatte verdiene, kan det forårsake alvorlige personskader og alvorlige skader.

ul.li: Obey the safety instructions of the hydraulic system when you connect the hydraulics to the trailer or the loader and operate the hydraulics. Refer to .
Only persons trained on the maintenance and repairs of the hydraulic system are permitted to install components to the system and to do maintenance and repairs to the system.
Do not start a task if you are not sure that you can do it.
Only use original spare parts for maintenance and repairs of the hydraulic system.
Only use parts with sufficient pressure resistance.
Make sure that the hydraulic hoses are serviceable. Replace damaged hydraulic hoses before you use the trailer or the loader.

conbody.p: Replace the filter elements in the hydraulic system after the first 50 hours of operation.
Replace the filter elements in the spring and autumn, or at intervals of 500 hours.
Change the oil in the hydraulic system at intervals of 1000 hours, if the tractor has good filtration.
Change the oil in the hydraulic system at intervals of 2000 hours, if the isolated hydraulic system has good filtration.
A significant amount of oil is not changed when an oil change is done. Make sure that the new oil is compatible with the remaining oil and that its quality is sufficient.
Use applicable hydraulic oil, high-quality motor oil or multipurpose oil in the hydraulic system. Do not use gear oils.
Obey the maintenance schedule and change the filters often. Also change the filters when you change the oil.

concept.title: Utskiftning av hydraulikkomponenter

conbody.p: Når du skifter ut hydraulikkslanger, koblinger, pakninger og andre komponenter i det hydrauliske systemet, bruk originale KESLA-reservedeler for best ytelse og sikkerhet.

concept.title: Hydraulic unit

task.title: Change the hydraulic oil in the hydraulic unit

step.cmd: Remove the breather cap (1) of the hydraulic unit.
Remove the drain plug (2) of the hydraulic unit.
Drain the oil to a waste oil container.
Install the drain plug.
Fill the hydraulic unit with new oil through the breather cap opening. Make sure that the oil is compatible with the hydraulic unit. Refer to for recommended oils.
Install the breather cap.

task.title: Replace the return filter

step.cmd: Remove the linchpins from the cover on top of the hydraulic unit and open the cover.
Open the return filter cover and lift the filter out.
Replace the filter element.
Put the filter into the correct position.
Tighten the filter cover with your hand.
Discard the old filter element.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Replace the pressure filter

step.cmd: Put a waste oil container below the pressure filter.
Open the screw at the bottom of the pressure filter.
Replace the filter element.
Put the filter into the correct position.
Tighten the screw at the bottom of the pressure filter.
Discard the old filter element.

concept.title: Trailer maintenance

conbody.p: These maintenance instructions include the usual maintenance procedures and the necessary checks and adjustments. Regular maintenance keeps the trailer serviceable for longer. Follow the maintenance instructions to keep the warranties valid.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Stramme hjullagrene

ul.li: Kontroller at hjullagrene er stramme.
Hvis det finnes spill når du roterer hjulet manuelt, juster spillet.
Gjør dette to ganger i året.
Hjulet må være klar bakken under inspeksjon og justering.
Kontroller at lagrene er riktig smurte. Smør ved behov.

context.p: For å stramme hjullagrene foreta trinnene nedenfor:

step.cmd: Fjern hjulkapselen.
Fjern splinten.
Vri kronemutrene med urviseren til du ikke lenger kan dreie hjulet lett for hånd.
Skru kronemutteren mot urviseren i 1/4 omdreining. Lås kronemutteren med en ny splint.
Kontroller at hjulet spinner og lagerspillet er korrekt.

concept.title: Sjekk av dekktrykket

ul.li: Sjekk dekktrykket to ganger i året.*)

conbody.p: *) Sørg for å justere dekktrykket riktig. Trykket kan være forskjellig for forskjellige dekkmerker og modeller. For riktig trykk se merkene på siden av dekket eller produsentens anvisninger.

concept.title: Sjekk av vognstangen og vognstangøyet

conbody.p: Sjekk vognstangøyet regelmessig. Hvis vognstangøyet er skadet eller slitt, skift det ut med en original KESLA-reservedel.
Generelle anvisninger:

ul.li: Hvis materialet er slitt 30 % sammenlignet med det originale vognstangøyet i en retning, skift det ut.

task.title: Examine the disc brakes

abstract.p: Examine the disc brakes regularly. Replace worn and damaged parts with new parts to keep the disc brakes serviceable for longer.

step.cmd: Examine the brake calipers and brake hoses. Replace them with new parts, if necessary.
Examine the brake pads for wear. Replace them with new parts, if necessary.
If you replace the brake pads, make sure that you do the initial adjustment for the brake pad play. Do the steps that follow:

substep.cmd: To move the brake pad closer to the brake disc, turn the threaded bar at the end of the brake caliper counterclockwise.
To move the brake pad away from the brake disc, turn the threaded bar at the end of the brake caliper clockwise.
When the brake pad touches the brake disc lightly, turn the threaded bar 3/4 of a turn clockwise to get the correct play.
The brakes adjust automatically during use.

step.cmd: Examine the brake discs for wear and make sure that they are not bent. Replace them with new parts, if necessary.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Examine the drive-equipment oil drain-tank

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Ved bruk av olje og smørefett må du overholde de lokale forskriftene og instruksjonene fra olje- og fettprodusentene.
Send inn avfallsolje til passende behandling i henhold til lokale lover og forskrifter.
Olje og fett kan inneholde tilsetningsstoffer som kan være farlige for huden og miljøet.

abstract.p: The drive equipment hydraulic system has a drain line with a pressure relief valve. The excess oil flows through the drain line to the drain tank. The drain tank is attached adjacent to the drive equipment on the trailer frame. Examine and remove the oil from the drain tank at weekly intervals.

step.cmd: Tilt the tipping platform with tractor hydraulics from the tractor cabin. Refer to and .
Remove the bolts and washers the from the drive equipment cover on top of the trailer frame.
Remove the cover to get access to the oil drain tank.
Disconnect the drain hose from the quick coupling on the oil drain tank.
Remove the nuts at the rear of the tank.
Remove the bolts, the washers and the tank.
Remove the cap from the tank.
Drain the oil to a waste oil container.
Install the cap.
Install the tank to the trailer frame with washers, bolts and nuts.
Connect the drain hose with the quick coupling.
Install the cover with washers and bolts.
Lower the tipping platform. Refer to and .

conbody.p: These maintenance instructions include the usual maintenance procedures and the necessary checks and adjustments. Regular maintenance keeps the loader serviceable for longer. Follow the maintenance instructions to keep the warranties valid.

concept.title: Svingningsmekanisme

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Smøring av svingningsmekanismen

step.cmd: Tilsett smøring i smøreniplene med en smørepistol. Trykk to til tre ganger for å presse ut den nødvendige mengden smøring.
Se for informasjon om plasseringen av smøreniplene.
Smør det øvre lageret på svingningsmekanismen regelmessig. Det har to smørenipler.
Hvert stabilisatorben har en smørenippel på øvre aksel, nedre aksel og på sylinderen. Smør alle tre niplene på hvert stabilisatorben.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Examine the oil level in the slewing mechanism

abstract.p: Examine the oil level of the slewing mechanism at intervals of 50 hours of operation.
Water must be drained from the slewing mechanism two times in a year. If not drained, water can freeze and cause damage to the slewing mechanism.

step.cmd: Tilt the loader 5-10 degrees in the direction of the fill plug (3). To tilt the loader, drive the vehicle in a position where its wheels on the drain plug's side are on higher ground than the wheels on the fill plug's side.
Examine the oil level from the oil level sight glass (1).
If the oil level is below the sight glass, add oil until the oil level is at the bottom edge of the fill hole.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Skift oljen i svingningsmekanismen.

abstract.p: Skift oljen etter 50 driftstimer og deretter etter intervaller på 2 år.
Oljemengden i svingningsmekanismen er ca. 2,6 liter.
Sørg for at du bruker transmisjonsolje av høy kvalitet (80W/90) i svingningsmekanismen.

step.cmd: Sett en avfallsoljebeholder under tappepluggen.
Fjern tappepluggen og fyllepluggen.
Tapp ut oljen.
Sett på plass tappepluggen.
Fyll svingningsmekanismen med ny olje. Kontroller at oljenivået er i nedre kant av fyllehullet. Kontroller også at oljen er kompatibel med svingningsmekanismen.
Sett på plass fyllepluggen.
Rengjør eventuelt oljesøl. Lever avfallsoljen til et innsamlingssted for avfallsolje.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Stram til festeskruene i svingningsmekanismen.

step.cmd: Undersøk stramheten på festeskruene i svingningsmekanismen etter de første 20 driftstimene. Deretter undersøker du stramheten etter intervaller på 250 driftstimer.
Stram festeskruene om nødvendig. Se for informasjon om korrekt tilstramningsmoment.

concept.title: Bommene

conbody.p: Hvis du skal skifte ut hydraulikkslangene i bommene, kan du gå til .

task.title: Tighten the joints

step.cmd: Tighten the joints (1). Tighten the nut until the gap is closed.
Tighten the joints (2). Tighten the nut until the washer is not easy to turn with your hand. Do not tighten the nut too tight.
Other joints (3) cannot be tightened.
Make sure that the lock screws on the axle flanges are tight.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Lubrication of the booms and extensions

step.cmd: Refer to for the location of lubrication points.
Lubricate the lift boom bearing with a grease gun. Lubricate the bearing until the grease starts to come out.
Lubricate the grease nipple on the bearing pipe in the top section of the pillar.
Lubricate the grease nipples on the bearing pipe in the joint between the lift boom and the outer boom.
Lubricate the bearing pipe in the joint of the lift boom. The grease nipple is below the lift boom.
Lubricate the joint bearings on the main lifting cylinder and the outer boom cylinder regularly.
To lubricate the rear glide pads of the extension, retract the extensions. Then supply grease with a grease gun to the grease nipple in the outer boom.
Retract the extensions. Supply grease with a grease gun to the bearings of the two sprocket wheels. The grease nipple is at the end of the axle.
To lubricate all the grease nipples of the loader in one boom position, retract the extensions. Then turn the outer boom below the lift boom. Make sure that the outer boom points down.
Keep the booms in the same position. Lubricate the inner surfaces of the extensions and the inner chain through the rear end of the outer boom.
Extend the extensions fully. Apply oil or grease to the top, bottom and side surfaces of the extensions.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Juster kjedene

note.p: Hvis du strammer kjedene for mye, kan det føre til hurtig slitasje på kjedene og kjedehjullagrene. Hvis kjeden er for slakk, kan den bevege seg til kanten av kjedehjulet og ødelegges.
Undersøk kjedene etter 20 driftstimer og deretter etter intervaller på 250 driftstimer.

step.cmd: Strekk ut forlengelsene fullt ut. Trekk deretter inn forlengelsene et lite stykke for å slakke kjeden.
Stram til kjedene. Skyv på kjeden med hånden for å teste spenningen. Hvis du kan skyve ned kjeden 2 til 3 cm i midten, er spenningen korrekt.
Kontroller at de to kjedene er like stramme.
Trekk inn forlengelsene.
Kontroller at avstanden (A) mellom brakettene på indre forlengelse (1) og ytre forlengelse (2) er ca. 10 mm når forlengelsene er helt trukket inn.

substep.cmd: Stram til eller løsne mutrene (3) for å justere avstanden om nødvendig.

task.title: Juster rotatorleddet for bremsen
task.abstract: Bremsekraften er justert til en grunninnstilling fra fabrikken. Når bremseplatene slites, reduseres bremsekraften. Gjør følgende for å justere bremsekraften:

step.cmd: For grunnleggende justering strammer du til låsemutteren inntil fjærpakkens mellomrom forsvinner.
Vri låsemutteren én omdreining med urviseren.
Juster bremsen om nødvendig.
For andre justeringer, se tabellen nedenfor.

concept.title: Juster forlengelsene

conbody.p: Undersøk forlengelsene og gjør de nødvendige justeringene etter de første 20 driftstimene. Deretter undersøker og justerer du etter intervaller på 250 driftstimer.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Juster klaringen i sideretning

abstract.p: Hvis det er for stor klaring mellom bommen og forlengelsene, justerer du klaringen i sideretning.

step.cmd: Fjern mutteren (1) og låseskruen (2) fra glideputen på siden.
For å redusere mellomrommet vrir du braketten for glideputen (3) med urviseren i samme grad fra de to sidene av bommen.
Hvis mellomrommet ikke blir mindre, er glideputen (4) funksjonsudyktig. Skift ut glideputen.
Løsne braketten for glideputen (3) inntil du kan montere låseskruen (2) i forrige spor. Lås låseskruen med mutteren (1).

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Juster den vertikale klaringen

note.p: Litt klaring er nødvendig. Hvis det ikke finnes noen klaring, slites glideputene svært raskt. Det er også mulig at forlengelsene ikke beveger seg hvis det ikke finnes noen klaring.

step.cmd: Fjern festeskruene (1) (2) fra den fremre glideputen øverst og nederst på bommen.
Fjern festeskruen (3) for braketten, brakettene (5) (7), mellomleggene (4) og glideputene (6) (8).
Legg til mellomlegg etter behov (tykkelse: 1 eller 2 mm).
Skift ut glideputen hvis høyden på mellomleggene er mer enn 3 mm.
Monter braketten, mellomleggene og glideputen.
Monter og stram festeskruene om nødvendig.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Skift hydraulikkoljen i bomsystemet

abstract.p: All oljen kan ikke tappes fra hydraulikksystemet. Det er derfor viktig å sørge for at den nye oljen er kompatibel med den gjenværende oljen. Se for mer informasjon om hydraulikkoljer.

step.cmd: Strekk løftebommen, den ytre bommen og forlengelsene helt ut.
Strekk klosylinderen helt ut.
Koble hydraulikkslangene fra sylindrene på stempelstangsiden. Plasser endene av de frakoblede slangene i en avfallsoljebeholder.
Koble returslangen fra hydraulikksystemet. Plasser enden av returslangen i en avfallsoljebeholder.
Hvis returslangen har en hurtigkobling, fjerner du den. Hvis du ikke ønsker å fjerne den, kan du montere hurtigkoblingsparet på hurtigkoblingen for å holde returlinjen åpen.
Trekk inn sylindrene med hydraulikk.
Drei bommen og rotatoren mellom maksimumsposisjonene to til tre ganger for hånd for å tappe bom- og rotatorslangene.
Koble de andre slangene fra sylindrene.
Rengjør om nødvendig oljetanken.
Skift ut filterelementene.
Pump ny olje gjennom hver slangelinje inntil det kommer ren olje ut av slangelinjene.
Monter slangene.
Fyll oljetanken med ny olje opptil maksimumsnivået.

For å fjerne oljen fra sylindrene betjener du hver funksjon to til tre ganger mellom maksimumsposisjonene. Betjen bare én funksjon om gangen. Vær svært forsiktig, ettersom luft i systemet kan forårsake plutselige, uønskede bevegelser av lasteren.

concept.title: Trykkmåling

messagepanel.howtoavoid: Vær svært forsiktig når du kobler fra hydraulikkslanger.
Ikke forsøk å finne lekkasjer med hånden. Olje under høyt trykk kan sprute ut fra defekte hydraulikkslanger.
Oljesprut er farlig for huden og øynene. Oppsøk lege umiddelbart hvis det oppstår en ulykke.

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Mål trykket i hydraulikksystemet

step.cmd: Betjen lasteren inntil hydraulikksystemet er ved normal driftstemperatur.
Juster motorens omdreiningshastighet til normal driftshastighet.
Lukk kloen.
La oljen flyte til klosylinderen.
Les av systemtrykket fra trykkmåleren som er koblet til trykkmålingskontakten.
Frigjør kontrollene. Les av friflyttrykket fra trykkmåleren.

concept.title: Varehus og lagring

task.domains: (topic abbrev-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic task) (topic task strictTaskbody-c) (topic task taskreq-d) (topic task+taskreq-d machineryTaskbody-c)
task.title: Long-term storage

ul.li: Do not let the children to go near the trailer or the loader during storage.

note.p: If you move the trailer with a tractor, always connect all hoses and cables.
Make sure that the booms and the grapple are in the transport position during storage.

context.p: If you put the trailer and the loader into storage for a long time, do the steps that follow:

step.cmd: Attach the hydraulic hoses to the quick couplings on the parking leg.
Clean the trailer and the loader fully, for example, with a high-pressure washer. Do not point the nozzle to the bearings or cylinder piston rod seals.
Lubricate all the lubrication points to remove water from the bearings and to prevent corrosion. Refer to .
Examine the oil level in the slewing mechanism. If necessary, add oil. Refer to .
Apply storage grease to all bare cylinder piston rods.
Apply paint on areas where the paint is chipped or worn off.
Repair all faults and defects and do the necessary adjustments. This is to make sure that the trailer and the loader will operate correctly when they are used again.
Keep the trailer and the loader away from direct sunlight in a shed or equivalent. If they are left outdoors, put a cover on them.
Put protection on the wheels and hoses to keep them away from direct sunlight.
Do not let any part of the trailer touch the ground. Put planks or equivalent below the wheels to keep the trailer off the ground during storage.
Keep the loader in vertical position during storage to prevent leakage of slewing machine lubrication oil.
Lower the loader on the platform into the transport position. Refer to .
Make sure that the parking leg does not hit anything during storage.

task.title: Start-up after storage

ul.li: Read this manual again before you operate the loader or do maintenance on it.

step.cmd: Clean the loader and the trailer fully.
Lubricate the grease points. Refer to .
Examine the oil level in the slewing mechanism. Refer to .
Clean the cylinder piston rods to remove the protective grease.
Tighten all bolts and nuts.
Examine the tire pressure.
Make sure that all adjustment are correct.
Make sure that the controls and safety equipment operate correctly.

concept.title: Removal from use

conbody.p: When the multipurpose trailer is at the end of its life and it is not serviceable, use applicable methods to remove it from use. Make sure that it does not cause damage to the environment.
Do one of the procedures that follow:

ol.li: Take the trailer to the scrap processing center, where it is disassembled in a controlled manner.

If you disassemble the trailer yourself, do the steps that follow:
Drain all the oil from the hydraulic system into a container. Send the used oil to a waste oil collection point.
Disconnect the hydraulic hoses and remove the trailer wheels. Send them to a rubber waste collection point.
Send the metal parts to a scrap collection center.

concept.title: Feilsøking

conbody.p: I feilsøkingstabellen finner du de vanligste feilene, årsakene og de nødvendige prosedyrene. Når du utfører reparasjonsarbeid og andre prosedyrer, må du alltid overholde alle instruksjonene om sikkerhet og drift av lasteren.

ul.li: Tanken er tom for olje.
Trykkslangens hurtigkobling er ikke koblet til, eller den er funksjonsudyktig.
Pumpen avgir ikke noe trykk.
Trykk- og returslangene er ikke koblet til korrekte posisjoner.
Tilsett olje
Undersøk alle tilkoblingene. Skift ut hurtigkoblingen om nødvendig.
Mål trykket fra trykkenden av styreventilen. Undersøk pumpens trykkavlastningsventil. Skift om nødvendig ut trykkavlastningsventilen.
Koble til slangene på riktig måte.

entry.p: Lasteren beveger seg litt eller mottar lite strøm

ul.li: Returkontakten er ikke koblet til, eller den er funksjonsudyktig.
Lasterens hovedutløsning eller pumpens trykkavlastningsventil er defekt eller skitten.
Pumpen er slitt eller traktorens trykkavlastningsventil er defekt eller skitten.
Undersøk tilkoblingen. Mål returtrykket.
Mål trykket fra trykkenden av styreventilen. Undersøk trykkavlastningsventilen, og skift den ut om nødvendig.
Mål trykket fra traktorens trykklinje.
Den spolespesifikke trykkavlastnings- ventilen er defekt eller skitten.
En lekkasje i sylindertetningen.
Ventilspolen er slitt.
Mål trykket under aktivering av funksjonen. Skift om nødvendig ut trykkavlastningsventilen.
Skift ut tetningene.
Skift ut spolen.

entry.p: Bommene senkes ned ved normal belastning

ul.li: En lekkasje i funksjonens trykkavlastningsventil.
Sylinderen blir varm under belastning.
En lekkasje i sylindertetningen.
En lekkasje i ventilspolen.
Skift ut trykkavlastningsventilen.
Skift ut tetningene.
Skift ut spolen.
Pumpen er slitt.
Pumpens kapasitet er for stor for ventilene.
Utilstrekkelig oljemengde i hydraulikksystemet.
Mål trykket mens oljen er varm. Skift om nødvendig ut pumpen.
Mål returtrykket og reduser pumpeytelsen.
Tilsett olje.

entry.p: Ventilspolene fungerer ikke på riktig måte

ul.li: Overopphetet hydraulikkolje.
Skittpartikler i ventilen.
Pinneboltene som kobler til ventilblokkene, er for stramme eller for slakke.
Se elementet ovenfor.
Påse at oljen og filtrene skiftes ut i henhold til anbefalingene.
Kontroller at tilstramningsmomentene er korrekte.
En lekkasje i svingningsmekanismens sylindertetning.
Det er for mye smøring i svingningsmekanismen.
En lekkasje i akseltetningen.
En lekkasje i svingningsmekanismens nedre plugg.
Lasteren er satt til oppbevaring i vippet posisjon.
Skift om nødvendig ut tetningene. Når oljen er svært kald, kan det forekomme små lekkasjer.
Tapp overflødig olje/smøring.
Vri på fjæren for akseltetningen for å stramme den til. Skift ut akseltetningen om nødvendig.
Undersøk tetningen og pluggen. Sørg for at pluggen er godt festet.
Kontroller at vippevinkelen ikke er større enn de tillatte ±25 gradene.
